If not allowed, the toolbar items cannot be unselected and the X buttons for the Photo/Link/Video/Poll panels is not available. // @param int allowTypePhoto - indicates if Photo toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int allowTypeLink - indicates if Link toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int allowTypePoll - indicates if Poll toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int allowTypeVideo - indicates if Video toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int showToggleEditor - indicates if Toggle Advanced Editor toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int showSmiley - indicates if Smiley toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int showAttachment - indicates if Attachment toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int initOnPageLoad - indicates if the ckeditor should be initialized on page load (1) or not (0). // @param int focusOnPageLoad - indicates if the title or editor (whichever is available) should be focused on page load (1) or not (0). // @param int showTitle - indicates if the title item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int showToolbar - indicates if the toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0). // @param int showCkeToolbar - indicates if the advanced ckeditor toolbar item is shown (1) or not (0) (the user preference overrides this param). // @param int hideButtonsUntilClick - indicates if the form buttons should be hidden until the editor is focused (1) or not (0). // @param int preloadJavascript - indicates if we want to preload the ckeditor javascript on page load (1) or wait until editor initialization to load it dynamically (0). // @param int compactButtonSpacing - If set to (1), the spacing between the panels and button row is reduced. // @param string defaultContentType - indicates the default Content Type ('Text', 'Gallery', 'Link', 'Video', 'Poll') selected. templategroup.name: CSS
templategroup.template:
BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The indicator that shows when loading something via AJAX. Currently it's pretty simple, so there's no modifiers or elements used. But it can be extended to use them in the future. Note that we're manually overriding the style so it'll display in the examples page. It's also missing the "js-loading-indicator" and "h-hide" classes to prevent the example getting hidden by css or javascript. Please include "js-loading-indicator" & "h-hide" and don't override the style via the style attribute in the actual code.

{vb:phrase working_ellipsis}
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* The Loading Indicator */ .b-ajax-loading-indicator { position: fixed; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: 50%; background-color: #fcf1ae; border: 1px solid #b6b6b6; padding: 7px; color: #000; font-size: 11px; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; z-index: 99999; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This is used for the pagenav box for paging article content.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-article-content-pagenav { background: {vb:stylevar comment_background}; border-top: 1px solid {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color}; border-bottom: 1px solid {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color}; } .b-article-content-pagenav__previous { display: inline-block; height: 24px; line-height: 24px; overflow: hidden; text-align: {vb:stylevar left}; float: {vb:stylevar left}; } .b-article-content-pagenav__chooser { text-align: center; } .b-article-content-pagenav__next { display: inline-block; height: 24px; line-height: 24px; overflow: hidden; text-align: {vb:stylevar right}; float: {vb:stylevar right}; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These CSS classes are for the attachment panel in the content entry UI. Specifically, just for a single attachment within the attachment panel as seen in the contententry_panel_attachments_item template.

{vb:phrase insert} {vb:phrase insert_image} {vb:phrase remove}
Example file with image thumbnail.png
{vb:phrase insert} {vb:phrase remove}
Example file with doc thumbnail.txt
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-attach-item { } .b-attach-item__thumb { /*border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar section_divider_color};*/ width: 35px; text-align: center; } .b-attach-item__image { max-height: 35px; max-width: 35px; margin: 0 auto; } .b-attach-item__controls { } .b-attach-item__filename { } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>



<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * AVATAR
 *------------------------------------*/
 
</vb:comment>



.b-avatar {
	display: inline-block;
	height:32px;
	width:32px;
	border: {vb:stylevar activity_stream_avatar_border};
}

.b-avatar > img {
	max-height:32px;
	max-width:32px;
}

.b-avatar--m {
	height:64px;
	width:64px;
}

.b-avatar--m > img {
	max-height:64px;
	max-width:64px !important;
}

.b-avatar--s {
	height:55px;
	width:55px;
}

.b-avatar--s > img {
	max-height:55px;
	max-width:55px !important;
}

.b-avatar--xs {
	height:24px;
	width:24px;
}

.b-avatar--xs > img {
	max-height:24px;
	max-width:24px !important;
}

.b-avatar--xxs {
	height:18px;
	width:18px;
}

.b-avatar--xxsm > img {
	max-height:18px;
	max-width:18px !important;
}

.b-avatar--auto
{
	width: 100%;
	height: auto; /* maintain aspect ratio @ resize */
}

.b-avatar--pmchat
{
	min-width: 14px;
	max-width: 42px;
	box-sizing: border-box;
}

.b-avatar--thread {
	border: {vb:stylevar thread_view_avatar_border};
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Primary button .b-button .b-button--primary

Regular button .b-button (and optionally .b-button--secondary)

File upload button: .b-button .b-button--upload (and other markup)

You can create a customized <input type="file"> interface by wrapping a tag with this class around the file input tag:

  1. 1. Create a file input tag with class b-form-input__file--hidden
  2. 2. Wrap it in a tag with class .b-button--upload (we recommend using an HTML <label> tag, because some browsers will register a click on the label as activating the contained file input tag.

Primary light button .b-button .b-button--primary-light

Special button .b-button .b-button--special

Pseudo-buttons -- buttons using a <span> or <a> element etc.

This is a <span> This is an <a> This is an <a> with no href

The same buttons in their disabled state

This is a <span> This is an <a> This is an <a> with no href

Note about pseudo buttons

When using a pseudo button (using the .b-button class on an element other than <button> or <input type="button">), it should always be accompanied by the .js-button class, which gives the pseudo button the same keyboard behavior as a real button, namely, you can use enter or spacebar to activate the button after tabbing to it. It should also be accompanied by a tabindex attribute set to 0 tabindex="0" to insert it into the keyboard navigation order of the page.

See also: css_b_link.css for pseudo links.

NOTE: There is no need to use .h-right or .h-left on the buttons or on the button group, in fact, using it will cause the buttons to not go full width in Responsive.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES ************************** Base button - When no other modifiers are applied, this looks the same as the secondary button. ************************** .b-button { -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; Inline block for buttons that are not inside a b-button-group display: inline-block; min-width: 65px; vertical-align: middle; -webkit-border-radius: 2px; -moz-border-radius: 2px; border-radius: 2px; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; outline:0; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; /* Since buttons are used in various places that set different font sizes/padding/line height, we have to use absolute units or else buttons would inherit various sizes. After we change to using relative sizes everywhere, we can use relative sizes here. font-size: 0.9em; line-height: 1.3em; padding: 0.35em 0.85em; */ font-size: 12px; line-height: 16px; padding: 4px 12px; /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_background}; color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; } /* Override color applied to A elements */ .b-button:link, .b-button:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; } /* This block of overly specific rules overrides other rules with the same selectors (minus the .b-button) that was making button text blue. I'm using specificity to override them instead of !important. TODO: Once everything is converted to BEM and uses a single class we won't need these. */ .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:hover, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:hover, .ui-state-default a.b-button, .ui-state-default a.b-button:link, .ui-state-default a.b-button:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; text-decoration: none; } /* This block of overly specific rules overrides other rules with the same selectors (minus the .b-button) that was making button text blue. I'm using specificity to override them instead of !important. TODO: Once everything is converted to BEM and uses a single class we won't need these. */ .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:hover, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:hover, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary:link, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color}; text-decoration: none; } .b-button, .ui-widget .b-button { Override jQuery UI's specific ui-widget button rules font-family: inherit; /* Since buttons are used in various places that set different font sizes, we have to use absolute units or else buttons would inherit various sizes. After we change to using relative sizes everywhere, we can use relative sizes here. font-size: 0.9em; */ font-size: 12px; } Override more jQuery UI's specific ui-widget button rules .ui-tabs .ui-tabs-nav .ui-tabs-anchor.b-button { /* Since buttons are used in various places that set different padding, we have to use absolute units or else buttons would inherit various sizes. After we change to using relative sizes everywhere, we can use relative sizes here. padding: 0.35em 0.85em; */ padding: 4px 12px; } /* Default hover/focus state */ .b-button:focus, .b-button:hover { cursor: pointer; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover}; } .b-button:focus { outline: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover.color} dotted 1px; } ************************** Primary button -- White text on bright blue background ************************** .b-button--primary, .b-button--primary:link, .b-button--primary:visited { /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color.color}; } .b-button--primary:focus, .b-button--primary:hover { /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_background_hover}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_border_hover}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color_hover.color}; } .b-button--primary:focus { outline: {vb:stylevar button_primary_border_hover.color} dotted 1px; } ************************** Primary light button -- Dark text on a light blue background ************************** .b-button--primary-light, .b-button--primary-light:link, .b-button--primary-light:visited { /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_text_color.color}; } .b-button--primary-light:focus, .b-button--primary-light:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_border_hover}; } .b-button--primary-light:focus { outline: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_border_hover.color} dotted 1px; } ************************** Secondary button -- Dark text on light grey background ************************** .b-button--secondary, .b-button--secondary:link, .b-button--secondary:visited { /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color.color}; } .b-button--secondary:focus, .b-button--secondary:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover}; } .b-button--secondary:focus { outline: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover.color} dotted 1px; } ************************** Special button -- Dark text on peach background ************************** .b-button--special, .b-button--special:link, .b-button--special:visited { /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_special_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_special_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_special_text_color.color}; } .b-button--special:focus, .b-button--special:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_special_border_hover}; } .b-button--special:focus { outline: {vb:stylevar button_special_border_hover.color} dotted 1px; } ************************** Disabled state. This applies to all button styles above, and must be defined after them to override them. We're using the attribute rather than a modifier to be practical. Of course, this may change... ************************** .b-button[disabled], .b-button[disabled]:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_text_color}; cursor: default; /* Any image specified in this background stylevar is overridden by the linear-gradient below */ background: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_background}; } /* ************************** Add the linear-gradient background image override to all buttons. This overrides the background image from the stylevars with this partially transparent linear gradient which allows the background color to show through. All buttons that use a background stylevar need to be added here. ************************** */ .b-button, .b-button[disabled], .b-button[disabled]:hover, .b-button--primary, .b-button--primary:link, .b-button--primary:visited, .b-button--primary:focus, .b-button--primary:hover, .b-button--primary-light, .b-button--primary-light:link, .b-button--primary-light:visited, .b-button--secondary, .b-button--secondary:link, .b-button--secondary:visited, .b-button--special, .b-button--special:link, .b-button--special:visited { background-image: -moz-linear-gradient(bottom, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 0%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.0) 50%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7) 100%); background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(bottom, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 0%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.0) 50%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7) 100%); background-image: linear-gradient(to top, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 0%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.0) 50%, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7) 100%); background-repeat: repeat; background-position: 0 0; } /* ************************** Full width buttons -- The second, overly specific selector is to override the margins added in b-button-group (css specificity) ************************** */ .b-button--full, .b-button-group .b-button.b-button--full { display: block; float: none; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; margin-bottom: 7px; width: 100%; } .b-button--full:last-child, .b-button-group .b-button.b-button--full:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } /* ************************** Wide buttons (not to be confused with full width buttons) ************************** */ .b-button--wide { min-width: 230px; } /* ************************** Narrow buttons (as narrow as possible, based on the text in them) ************************** */ .b-button--narrow { min-width: 0; } /*-------------------------------------- * UPLOAD BUTTON * -------------------------------------- * * You can create a customized interface by wrapping a tag * with this class around the file input tag: * * 1. Create a file input tag with class .b-form-input__file--hidden * 2. Wrap it in a tag with class .b-button--upload (we recommend using an HTML * .b-button--upload { position: relative; overflow: hidden; } ************************** Sitebuilder buttons -- Green with rounded corners The colors should probably be in stylevars, BUT for now I'm just Copying/porting this CSS from the previous declarations. ************************** .b-button--sitebuilder { border-radius: 12px; min-width: 75px; padding: 0.25em 1.2em; } .b-button--sitebuilder, .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--secondary { background-color: #ced0d1; color: #323b44; border: 1px solid #b3b3b3; text-shadow: 0 2px 2px #dfdfdf; box-shadow: 0 1px 2px #cecece; } .b-button--sitebuilder:hover, .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--secondary:hover { background-color: #adb2b5; border: 1px solid #b3b3b3; } .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--primary { background-color: #9bd43e; color: #2c3c12; border: 1px solid #94b357; text-shadow: 0 2px 2px #c5df8e; box-shadow: 0 1px 2px #c5df8e; } .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--primary:hover { background-color: #b7fc62; border: 1px solid #94b357; } /* ************************** Button text ************************** */ .b-button__text-primary { Placeholder, currently not used for CSS The .js- prefixed counterpart is used in JS. } .b-button__text-secondary { Placeholder, currently not used for CSS. The .js- prefixed counterpart is used in JS. } /* ************************** Button icons ************************** */ .b-button__icon { background: transparent url(images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png) no-repeat scroll 0 0; display: inline-block; height: 8px; width: 8px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px; } .ie7 .b-button__icon { display: inline; zoom: 1; } .b-button__icon--plus { background-position: -240px -80px; margin-bottom: 1px; } .b-button__icon--check { background-position: -256px -96px; margin-bottom: 1px; } TODO refactor follow_button, unsubscribe_button, post-reply-btn, etc I moved all these here as the first step to refactoring the .button-icon class into .b-button__icon .b-button--follow .b-button__icon, .follow_button .b-button__icon { background-position: -240px -80px; margin-bottom: 1px; } .b-button--follow.isSubscribed .b-button__icon, .follow_button.subscribed_button .b-button__icon { background-position: -256px -96px; margin-bottom: 1px; } .b-button--unfollow .b-button__icon, .unsubscribe_button .b-button__icon { display: none; } .b-button--follow.subscribe_pending .b-button__icon, .follow_button.subscribe_pending .b-button__icon { display: none; } .share-btn .b-button__icon { background:transparent url(images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png) no-repeat scroll -256px -80px; width: 14px; height: 9px; } .post-reply-btn .b-button__icon, .join-btn .b-button__icon { width: 0; height: 0; background: none; display: none; } .pending-post-overlay-container .b-button__icon { background: transparent url(images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png) no-repeat scroll -512px -16px; height: 10px; width: 6px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous .b-button__icon { background-position: -464px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous:hover .b-button__icon { background-position: -480px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous.hide .b-button__icon { background-position: -496px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next .b-button__icon { background-position: -512px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next:hover .b-button__icon { background-position: -528px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next.hide .b-button__icon { background-position: -544px -16px; } /* ************************** Dropdown Menu Buttons -- Buttons that turn into a dropdown menu This is essentially the ".split-button" system that needs to be refactored ************************** */ /* This is the containing element for the actual button and menu But it needs to behave like an actual button in terms of position and spacing inside the button group */ .b-button--dropdown-menu-button { height: 26px; padding: 0; } /* Temp fix for VBV-15891. This will be reworked with the split-button refactor VBV-15864 */ .b-button--dropdown-menu-button .button-text { border: 0 none; background: transparent; margin-top: 5px; padding: 0; } .b-button--dropdown-menu-button .b-button__icon { border: 0 none; margin-bottom: 3px; } /* End temp fix */ /* ************************** Responsive buttons -- Larger in tablet size; stacked and larger in phone size. ************************** */ /* Responsive tablet */ .l-small .b-button { font-size: 1.25em; padding: 0.25em 0.85em; font-weight: normal; /* When buttons are not in a button group, they won't stack in responsive, but there are often enough buttons that they will wrap onto two lines. We add a bottom margin to deal with that. VBV-10848 */ margin-bottom: 4px; } /* Responsive phone */ .l-xsmall .b-button { font-size: 1.4em; padding: 0.5em 0.85em; font-weight: normal; /* When buttons are not in a button group, they won't stack in responsive, but there are often enough buttons that they will wrap onto two lines. We add a bottom margin to deal with that. VBV-10848 */ margin-bottom: 4px; } /* Responsive temp fix for VBV-15891. This will be reworked with the split-button refactor VBV-15864 See .split-button above */ .l-small .b-button--dropdown-menu-button { font-size: 1.25em; padding: 0; } .l-small .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .button-set .button-text { Calculated to match 1.25em font-size: 16.25px; margin: 0; width: 100%; } .l-small .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .submenu li { height: 30px; line-height: 31px; } .l-xsmall .b-button--dropdown-menu-button { height: 36px; font-size: 1.4em; margin-bottom: 10px; padding: 0; } .l-xsmall #pmFloatingBarContent .b-button--dropdown-menu-button, .l-xsmall #privateMessageContainer .b-button--dropdown-menu-button { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .l-xsmall .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .button-set .td:first-child { width: 100%; } .l-xsmall .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .button-set .button-text { Calculated to match 1.4em font-size: 18.2px; } .l-xsmall .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .submenu { top: 34px; } .l-xsmall .private-message-widget .split-button .split-button-wrapper .submenu li { height: 34px; line-height: 35px; } /* End temp fix */ END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This is a re-usable block for grouping buttons together. It separates buttons horizontally within the group at desktop screen sizes, and stacks the buttons vertically at Responsive (small) screen sizes. It also controls if the buttons are grouped to the left or to the right of the screen using the .b-button-group--left and .b-button-group--right modifiers. Obviously, a pre-requisite is that the b-button css will also be loaded/used.

For the left/right aligned button groups, the group itself is still full-width, but the buttons inside the group are floated left or right.

Right aligned button group (default)

Left aligned button group

The .b-button--opposite modifier class allows you to add a button that will be displayed on the opposite side of the group from where the other buttons are.

NOTE: There is no need to use .h-right or .h-left on the buttons, in fact, using it will cause the buttons to not go full width in Responsive. We should also avoid using the .h-right or .h-left classes on the button group. Instead we should have one full-width button group, and if you need to a button or buttons to the opposite side of the group, use the .b-button--opposite class.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-button-group:after { /* clearfix */ clear: both; content: "."; display: block; font-size: 0; height: 0; line-height: 0; visibility: hidden; } .b-button-group .b-button, .b-button-group--right .b-button { display: block; float: {vb:stylevar right}; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } .b-button-group--left .b-button { float: {vb:stylevar left}; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } /* modifier to float a button to the opposite side of the group from where all the other buttons are */ .b-button-group .b-button--opposite, .b-button-group--right .b-button--opposite { float: {vb:stylevar left}; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .b-button-group--left .b-button--opposite { float: {vb:stylevar right}; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } /* Last one doesn't need the margin */ .b-button-group .b-button:last-child { /* Applying the same value to left and right, so stylevars aren't necessary. */ margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; } /* Responsive, stack buttons */ .l-xsmall .b-button-group { float: none; clear: both; /* left/right stylevars not needed, since we're setting both the same */ margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-button-group .b-button, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--right .b-button, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--left .b-button { float: none; width: 100%; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; margin-bottom: 10px; } .l-xsmall .b-button-group .b-button:last-child, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--right .b-button:last-child, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--left .b-button:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } .b-button-group--demo { border: 1px solid #CCC; padding: 15px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Example of the b-channel-nav block. Note that it can be nested for more than one level of navigation and highlights the currently selected item in bold. By adding the modifier b-channel-nav--radio-buttons and changing the markup, this block can also be used to output a set of radio buttons for choosing a channel. This is used on the article creation page.

  • Item One
  • Item Two
    • Sub-item One
    • Sub-item Two
  • Item Three (currently selected)
  • Item Four
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-channel-nav { list-style-type: square; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 14px; } .b-channel-nav__item { color: {vb:stylevar section_divider_color}; } .b-channel-nav__item--selected { font-weight: bold; } .b-channel-nav__item--selected .b-channel-nav { font-weight: normal; } .b-channel-nav__item-unpublished { color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_login_error_text_color}; /* this stylevar should be renamed to warning_color or similar*/ } .b-channel-nav--radio-buttons { list-style-type: none; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; max-height: 250px; overflow: auto; } .b-channel-nav--radio-buttons .b-channel-nav--radio-buttons { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 20px; max-height: none; overflow: visible; } .b-channel-nav--radio-buttons .b-channel-nav__item { color: inherit; } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

Builds upon b-post to display comments.

<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * COMMENT (individual comments)
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-comment {
	background: {vb:stylevar comment_background};
	-moz-border-radius: 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 0;
	border-top-color: {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color};
	border-width: 1px 0 0;
	border-radius: 0;
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	box-sizing: border-box;
	margin: 0;
}

.b-comment:first-child {
	border-top-color: #FFF;
}

.b-comment__author {
	font-size: 14px;
	font-weight: bold;
}

.b-comment .b-divider {
	display: none;
}

.b-comment--blog,
.b-comment--article {
	background: {vb:stylevar list_item_background};
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 0px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 0px;
}

.b-comment.b-post--unapproved {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background};
}

.b-comment.b-post--deleted {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_deleted_background};
}

<vb:comment>
	Inline moderation hilghight should always override the other colors.
	@TODO: Rename .inlinemod_highlight when we redo inlinemod CSS. And use a proper stylevar!
</vb:comment>
.b-comment.inlinemod_highlight {
	background: #D6E8EF;
}

.b-comment__edit-header {
	display: none;
}

<vb:comment>When editing a comment, swap the comment header and timestamp.</vb:comment>
.b-comment.b-post--edit .b-comment__edit-header {
	display: block;
}
.b-comment.b-post--edit .b-post__timestamp {
	display: none;
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * COMMENTS
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-comments {
	margin-bottom: 15px;
}

.b-comments--blog,
.b-comments--article {
	margin-bottom: 0px;
}

.b-comments__header,
.b-comments__footer {
	border-width: 1px 0;
	border-color: {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color} transparent {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color};
	border-style: solid;
	background: {vb:stylevar comment_background};
	font-size: 11px;
	font-weight: bold;
	line-height: 11px;
}

.b-comments--blog .b-comments__header,
.b-comments--blog .b-comments__footer,
.b-comments--article .b-comments__header,
.b-comments--article .b-comments__footer {
	background: {vb:stylevar list_item_background};
	border-bottom: none;
}

.b-comments__pagination--up,
.b-comments__pagination--down {
	text-align: center; 
	width: 15px;
	height: 15px;
	display: inline-block;
	background: {vb:stylevar button_arrow_background};
	vertical-align: middle;
	border: {vb:stylevar button_arrow_border};
	cursor:pointer;
	-moz-border-radius: 2px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 2px;
	border-radius: 2px;
}

.b-comments__pagination--up .b-icon,
.b-comments__pagination--down .b-icon {
	/* attempt to center the icons */
	margin-top: 4px;
}

.b-comments__comments {
	width: 100%;
	border-bottom: 1px solid {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color};
}

.b-comments--blog .b-comments__comments,
.b-comments--article .b-comments__comments {
	border-bottom: none;
}

<vb:comment>
	We're using b-media with the b-comments__footer block and b-media's display:block
	is overriding h-hide.
</vb:comment>
.b-comments__footer.h-hide {
	display: none;
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * COMMENT ENTRY
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-comment-entry {
	border-top: 1px solid {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color};
	border-bottom: 1px solid {vb:stylevar comment_divider_color};
	background: {vb:stylevar comment_background};
}

.b-comment-entry__textbox {
	background: {vb:stylevar form_field_background};
	border: {vb:stylevar form_field_border};
	font: normal 12px Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif;
	color: inherit;
	padding:12px;
	margin:0;
	resize:none;
	line-height:16px;
	-moz-border-radius: 3px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 3px;
	border-radius: 3px;
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	box-sizing: border-box;
	width: 100%;
	height: 58px;
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

A dropdown menu component.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* TODO use element components for the colors, borders, and padding in this template See VBV-15345 */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown { position: relative; display: inline-block; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--conversation-toolbar { Match the height of .conversation-toolbar (doesn't use a stylevar) height: 36px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--main-menu { Match the height of #channel-tabbar height: {vb:stylevar header_tabbar_height}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--inactive { /* placeholder used on horizontal menus to indicate they will turn into dropdown menus at small sizes. The placeholder will cause the dropdown css file to be loaded (this file) */ } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; padding: 0.2em 0.9em; background: #ccc; color: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_text_color}; cursor: pointer; display: block; height: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--has-icon { border-color: transparent; background: transparent; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger:hover, .b-comp-menu-dropdown:hover .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger, .b-comp-menu-dropdown--open .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}; border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; border-bottom: 0 solid transparent; /* must match border width */ margin-bottom: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.width}{vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.units}; position: relative; /* z-index one more than the __content element */ z-index: 99999; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content { border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; /* top margin x * 2 must match border width (currently 1) */ margin: -{vb:math {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.width} * 2}{vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.units} 0 0 0; padding: 0; position: absolute; top: 100%; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: auto; display: none; list-style: none; /* make the content at least as wide as the trigger */ min-width: 100%; /* z-index one less than the __trigger element */ z-index: 99998; background: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_background.backgroundColor}; background: -webkit-gradient(linear, {vb:stylevar left} top, {vb:stylevar left} bottom, from({vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}), to({vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor})); background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}); background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}); background: -ms-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}); background: -o-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}); filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='{vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}', EndColorStr='{vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}'); background: linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor}); } Content (dropdown) left aligned with the trigger element (default) .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--left, .b-comp-menu-dropdown.h-left .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content { {vb:stylevar left}: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: auto; } Content (dropdown) right aligned with the trigger element .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--right, .b-comp-menu-dropdown.h-right .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content { {vb:stylevar right}: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: auto; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown:hover .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content, .b-comp-menu-dropdown--open .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content { display: inline-block; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { display: block; padding: 0.2em 0.9em; cursor: pointer; white-space: nowrap; border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:first-child { border-top: 0 none; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--divider { border-top: 2px solid {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--indent1 { padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 0.9em; background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_item_background_active}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--current { font-weight: bold; background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_item_background_active}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:hover { background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_item_background_active}; } /* We need extra selectors for adding the color to override the base styles until those are removed or changed. This should only use ".b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a" as the selector. */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:active, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a:visited { color: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_text_color}; } /* Hide the "like" count in the dropdown menu */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-post-control__bubble-flyout { display: none; } /** RESPONSIVE **/ .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown { font-size: 1.2em; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger, .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { padding: 0.4em 1.5em; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--has-icon { /* Don't increase padding when it's just the icon */ padding: 0.2em 0.9em; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { /*width: 100%;*/ } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--indent1 { padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 2.5em; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .b-icon { /* This hides the icons on each menu item in the dropdown menu */ display: none; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-post-control__bubble-flyout-container { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These CSS classes are for the content slider and the content slider module.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-content-slider__wrapper { border: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_border}; } .b-content-slider__wrapper--hidden { visibility: hidden; } .b-content-slider { position: relative; top: 0px; {vb:stylevar left}: 0px; /* width set in JS */ /* height modified in JS, based on the module_height setting */ /* This needs !important so it returns to the correct size after exiting responsive mode (jssor copies the height and applies it directly to the element, which is higher specificity than a class-based rule.) */ height: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_height} !important; } .b-content-slider__slides { cursor: move; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; {vb:stylevar left}: 0px; top: 0px; /* width set in JS */ /* height modified in JS, based on the module_height setting */ height: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_height}; } .b-content-slider__slide { /* Default background, overridden by the content preview image, if available */ background: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_background}; /* Size and position applies to all backgrounds */ -webkit-background-size: cover; -moz-background-size: cover; -o-background-size: cover; background-size: cover; background-position: center center; cursor: pointer; } .b-content-slider__slide-caption { position: absolute; /* bottom adjusted in JS based on the module_height setting */ bottom: 35px; {vb:stylevar left}: 115px; width: 90%; height: 50px; color: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_caption_text_color}; } .b-content-slider__slide-caption-background { position: absolute; /* bottom adjusted in JS based on the module_height setting */ bottom: 30px; {vb:stylevar left}: 0px; width: 100%; height: 60px; background: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_caption_background}; opacity: 0.5; } .b-content-slider__title { font-size: 20pt; line-height: 33px; } .b-content-slider__arrow { width: 55px; height: 55px; /* bottom adjusted in JS based on the module_height setting */ bottom: 32px; } .b-content-slider__arrow--left { {vb:stylevar left}: 6px; } .b-content-slider__arrow--right { {vb:stylevar right}: 6px; } .b-content-slider__bullets { position: absolute; bottom: 4px; {vb:stylevar right}: 6px; } /* jssor "adds" the "av" class by simply appending it to className, without a space. Since we are using the b-content-slider__bullet class on this element, the class when active becomes b-content-slider__bulletav. To work around the issue, we need to handle the b-content-slider__bulletav class as well, even though it doesn't conform to BEM. This also applies to the jssor "dn" class. "av" = active, "dn" = mousedown */ .b-content-slider__bullet, .b-content-slider__bulletav, .b-content-slider__bulletdn { position: absolute; width: 21px; height: 21px; text-align:center; line-height:21px; background: url(js/jquery/jssor/img/b03.png) no-repeat; overflow:hidden; cursor: pointer; } /* This rule needs to use !important to override the jssor CSS */ .b-content-slider__bulletav, .b-content-slider__bulletav:hover, .b-content-slider__bulletdn, .b-content-slider__bulletdn:hover, .b-content-slider__bullet:hover { color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color.color}; background-position: -95px -4px !important; font-weight: bold; } /* needs to specify the 'a' element to override the global rules we have on the 'a' element */ a.b-content-slider__link { color: {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_caption_text_color}; } .b-content-slider__link:hover { text-decoration: underline; } /* jssor rules */ /* jssor slider arrow navigator skin 03 css */ /* .jssora03l (normal) .jssora03r (normal) .jssora03l:hover (normal mouseover) .jssora03r:hover (normal mouseover) .jssora03ldn (mousedown) .jssora03rdn (mousedown) */ .jssora03l, .jssora03r, .jssora03ldn, .jssora03rdn { position: absolute; cursor: pointer; display: block; background: url(js/jquery/jssor/img/a03.png) no-repeat; overflow: hidden; } .jssora03l { background-position: -3px -33px; } .jssora03r { background-position: -63px -33px; } .jssora03l:hover { background-position: -123px -33px; } .jssora03r:hover { background-position: -183px -33px; } .jssora03ldn { background-position: -243px -33px; } .jssora03rdn { background-position: -303px -33px; } /* jssor slider bullet navigator skin 03 css */ /* .jssorb03 div (normal) .jssorb03 div:hover (normal mouseover) .jssorb03 .av (active) .jssorb03 .av:hover (active mouseover) .jssorb03 .dn (mousedown) */ .jssorb03 div, .jssorb03 div:hover, .jssorb03 .av { background: url(js/jquery/jssor/img/b03.png) no-repeat; overflow: hidden; cursor: pointer; } .jssorb03 div { background-position: -5px -4px; } .jssorb03 div:hover, .jssorb03 .av:hover { background-position: -35px -4px; } .jssorb03 .av { background-position: -65px -4px; } .jssorb03 .dn, .jssorb03 .dn:hover { background-position: -95px -4px; } /* Responsive Mode -- Increase the slider height by 60px and move the caption & caption background down so that they show underneath the slider image. */ .l-small .b-content-slider { /* This needs !important so it sets the correct size when entering responsive mode (jssor copies the height and applies it directly to the element, which is higher specificity than a class-based rule.) */ height: {vb:math {vb:stylevar module_contentslider_height.size} + 60}{vb:stylevar module_contentslider_height.units} !important; overflow: hidden; } .l-small .b-content-slider__slide-caption-background { bottom: -60px; } .l-small .b-content-slider__slide-caption { bottom: -55px; {vb:stylevar left}: 10px; } .l-small .b-content-slider__slides, .l-small .b-content-slider__slide { /* !important is needed to override jssor styling */ overflow: visible !important; } .l-small .b-content-slider__title { font-size: 16pt; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This block is used for form checkboxes or radio buttons and their labels. Note that we wrap the checkbox/radio button in the <label> tag with the text. And the text itself is wrapped with the <span> tag. To address the issue of spacing which normally happens with white space and inline elements, the form control is used together with the b-media block. This gives us more control and also lets the text nicely line up to the right of the control instead of under it. Examples:

I love...
I will only commit code that...
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Form Checkboxes / Radio Buttons */ /** * Note that we have a control block because the checkbox/radio button is made up of both * the form element and a label. * * The two are treated similar enough that it makes sense to combine them into a single * css block. If we do need to treat them differently, we should use --checkbox or --radio * modifiers. * * The text itself is wrapped in a tag (usually span) with the b-form-control__text class * for future proofing. In case we need to apply certain styles that just target the text * and not the whole label including the control. * **/ .b-form-control__label { /* placeholder */ } .b-form-control__control { margin-top: 3px; /* Provide some extra spacing between the checkbox and the label text. */ margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 3px; } .b-form-control__text { } Used to modify any controls in a form that are dependent on another control, e.g., this control is enabled/accessible depending on the state of another control. .b-form-control--dependent { padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 40px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This block is used for form input text fields. Examples:

File inputs are quite different and we do a lot of work for custom styling. Please see css_b_button.css for usage.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Form Inputs */ .b-form-input__input { background: {vb:stylevar form_field_background}; border: {vb:stylevar form_field_border}; -moz-border-radius: 3px; -webkit-border-radius: 3px; border-radius: 3px; color: {vb:stylevar form_field_text_color}; font: inherit; height: 18px; padding: 3px 8px; Keeps input vertically aligned with any buttons that are to the right of the input. vertical-align: middle; } @TODO The height should really be vb:math'd to add up the height, padding, and border sizes... .b-form-input__input--full { -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; height: 26px; width: 100%; } .b-form-input__input--s { font-size: 12px; height: 13px; line-height: 12px; padding: 3px 6px; } .b-form-input__input--year { width: 32px; } .b-form-input__label { font-weight: bold; } .b-form-input__hint { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 0; font-size: 11px; color: #777; } .l-small .b-form-input__label { display: block; margin-bottom: 4px; } Hide IE10's clear button (X) inside input text control .b-form-input__input--hide-clear-button::-ms-clear { display:none; } /*-------------------------------------- * FILE INPUT * * You can create a customized file input by using the --hidden modifier on * your tag. * * Usage: Please see .b-button--upload * * Note: All the funky rules are for browser compatiblity. We're essentially * trying to get the user to click the "browse..." button they'd normally see * but have it show our customized style underneath so it'll look nice. * Also note we're using right without a stylevar and direction: ltr to standardize * and make it easier for us. * **/ .b-form-input__file--hidden { position: absolute; top: 0; right: 0; opacity: 0; -o-transform: translate(250px,-50px) scale(1); -moz-transform: translate(-300px,0) scale(5); transform: translate(-300px,0) scale(5); direction: ltr; cursor: pointer; margin: 0; border-width: 0 30px 100px 200px; border-color: transparent; /* We're using this instead of filter: alpha(opacity=0) because VBV-10295 */ height: 10px; width: 10px; z-index: -1; } Progress bar that is used with .b-form-input__file--hidden .b-form-input__upload-progress { background: url('images/loader-box-blue.gif'); width: 128px; height: 15px; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 3px; } .b-form-input__upload-progress.h-hide { Since we explicitly set display (above), we need to make it compatible with .h-hide display: none; } .b-form-input__upload-progress--sitebuilder { background: url('images/loader-box-light.gif'); } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION {vb:js js/css_b_form_select_example.js}

This block is used for our drop down boxes. Note, we use the selectBox plugin so in order to not re-invent the wheel, we're just modifying the stuff we need. We rely on the plugin hiding the actual select tag.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Form Select Boxes */ .b-form-select__select, .b-form-select__select:focus { background: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_background}; /*border: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_border};*/ outline: none; height: 24px; } The selectBox-arrow class is automatically generated by the selectBox plugin and can't be changed. We might need to move most of this to b-icon... .b-form-select__select .selectBox-arrow { top: 45%; {vb:stylevar right}: 8px; width: 7px; height: 8px; background: transparent url("images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png") no-repeat scroll -48px -16px; } The selectBox-label class is automatically generated by the selectBox plugin and can't be changed. We need to specify it to override some of the default plugin styles. We can target the actual list of options from the drop down using this class because the selectBox plugin will add the classes from the original select tag and append them with "-selectBox-dropdown-menu". This is why it's not following the naming convention very well. On the other hand, a multi select box doesn't give us a similar option, so we use another way to target it. .b-form-select__select.selectBox, /* override for base anchor tag and multi-select */ .b-form-select__select .selectBox-label, /* override for the label for a drop down */ .b-form-select__select-selectBox-dropdown-menu /* override for drop down options */ { background: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_background}; color: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_text_color}; vertical-align: top; } Unfortunately, we don't have a way to target links inside the selectBox options without using the a tag. .b-form-select__select.selectBox .selectBox-selected a, /* overrid multi-select */ .b-form-select__select-selectBox-dropdown-menu.selectBox-options .selectBox-selected a, /* overrid dropdown */ .b-form-select__select.selectBox .selectBox-hover a, /* overrid multi-select */ .b-form-select__select-selectBox-dropdown-menu.selectBox-options .selectBox-hover a /* overrid dropdown */ { background: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_background_hover}; color: {vb:stylevar form_dropdown_text_color_hover}; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This block is used for form textarea fields. Examples:

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Form Textarea Inputs */ .b-form-textarea__textarea { background: {vb:stylevar form_field_background}; border: {vb:stylevar form_field_border}; -moz-border-radius: 3px; -webkit-border-radius: 3px; border-radius: 3px; color: {vb:stylevar form_field_text_color}; font: inherit; height: auto; padding: 8px; resize: none; } .b-form-textarea__textarea--full { -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; width: 100%; } .b-form-textarea__textarea--ckeditor { -moz-border-radius: 0; -webkit-border-radius: 0; border-radius: 0; padding: 18px 15px; height: 70px; border: none; } .b-form-textarea__textarea--resize { resize: both; } .b-form-textarea__textarea--v-resize { resize: vertical; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This is for styling help/faq tables. I wanted to separate this from b-table because that should be more of a general layout. Refactoring for a more responsive layout was not considered at the time this was created due to time constraints.

Bold, Italic and Underline
These codes provide basic formatting to your text.
Usage: [b]value[/b]
[i]value[/i]
[u]value[/u]
Example Usage: [b]This is bold text.[/b]
[i]This is italic text[/i]
[u]This is underlined text[/u]
Example Output: This is bold text.
This is italic text
This is underlined text.
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* FAQ / Help Table */ .b-help-table { /* We don't have any rules for this yet. */ } .b-help-table--full { width: 100%; } .b-help-table__cell { border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar post_controls_divider_color}; } .b-help-table__cell--header { background-color: #EBF3F9; text-align: {vb: stylevar left}; font-weight: bold; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION
Used the restore class on the parent div to cheaply get back the numbering and bullet points on the lists.

NAMING CONVENTIONS

For specific icon definitions, be sure to follow our BEM-based naming scheme, which works like so:

  • begin any individual icon definition with the '.b-icon__' prefix.
  • append a visual description of the icon. This may be different from the actual meaning of the icon in its context. E.g. 'pencil' describes the icon better than 'edit'.
  • If there are multiple versions of an icon, try first to distinguish them based on visual difference (e.g. b-icon__plus-circle vs b-icon__plus).
  • If the multiple versions are different sizes, use s, m, l to distinguish them: (e.g. b-icon__arrow-down-m for medium-sized arrow pointing down).
  • Failing those, just add a number at the end to indicate there is more than one version of an icon. (e.g. b-icon__search-2)
  • Finally, use modifiers to define either different colors or states of an icon. Here are some examples:
    1. .b-icon__arrow-down-s--active
    2. .b-icon__speech-double--active
    3. .b-icon__like--disabled

Caveats: there may be naming instances below that don't perfectly correspond to the conventions described above. For example, 'search' might better be represented by 'magnifying-glass'. That might be a bit verbose, and in this instance it's reasonably clear what the intent is.

HOW TO PUT AN ICON IN TO YOUR HTML

To display an existing icon in your HTML template, follow these steps:

  1. Using a generic DIV or SPAN element, add the .b-icon class in order to refer to the sprite image.
  2. Look at the sprite image to determine the location of your desired icon by its row (from top to bottom) and position (left to right).
  3. Navigate the CSS document to the appropriate row and count rules to the proper position. You should see a class name that resembles a description of your icon (e.g. b-icon__pencil). Add that class to your DIV or SPAN.
  4. These classes do not provide additional spacing or positioning rules. Those must be handled on an individual basis in your implementation.
  5. For concrete examples, see the DIVs below.

HOW TO ADD AN ICON TO THE SPRITE MAP

Adding an icon is fairly straightforward:

  1. Update the sprite_icons_vb_ltr.png and sprite_icons_vb_rtl.png files with your new icon.
  2. Determine the background offset, width and height of your icon.
  3. Name your icon using our BEM-based method. It is best to describe the icon, rather than what is is used for, as that allows reuse. So "pencil" is preferred over "edit" and "x-circle" over "delete".
  4. Place the CSS rules in the appropriate location in this file, based upon the image's row and left to right position.
  5. Include the .b-icon class and your specific icon class in the HTML tag when you place it.
  6. Add your new icon to the example HTML below.

EXAMPLE HTML

NOTE: The blocks of CSS rules below correspond to the horizontal rows of the sprite image, going from top to bottom and left to right.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /*-------------------------------------- * ICONS *------------------------------------*/ .b-icon { display: inline-block; background:transparent url("images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png") no-repeat scroll 0 0; overflow: hidden; text-indent: -99999px; } /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------- * Row 1 icons * **/ .b-icon__minus-circle { background-position: 0 -16px; width: 14px; height: 14px; } .b-icon__plus-circle { background-position: -16px -16px; width: 14px; height: 14px; } .b-icon__search { background-position: -32px -16px; width: 16px; height: 16px; } .b-icon__arrow-down-s--active { background-position: -48px -16px; width: 7px; height: 5px; } .b-icon__arrow-down-s--disabled { background-position: -64px -16px; width: 7px; height: 5px; } /* TODO 3 icons skipped here */ .b-icon__facebook-24 { background-position: -144px -16px; width: 24px; height: 24px; } .b-icon__twitter-24 { background-position: -176px -16px; width: 24px; height: 24px; } .b-icon__oauth-24 { background-position: -208px -16px; width: 24px; height: 24px; } .b-icon__facebook-12 { background-position: -256px -16px; </vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Layout is used for the sole purpose of positioning items relative to one another. In this initial implementation, a layout class is prepended with l- in order to distinguish it from block and helper classes.

To create a layout, begin with an .l-row wrapper. This is merely a clearfixed container that holds columns. Note that it can be a useful place to add a margin or padding.

To create columns, you need to decide whether you want percentage-based fluid columns or to have a fixed-width column supplemented by adjoining fluid column.

Fluid columns

The fluid option is made up of a 12-column grid at desktop width and a four-column grid at "mobile" (less than iPad portrait) width. So, if you wanted to have a row with one 25% width column and one 75% column, which change to full-width columns at mobile size, you would apply .l-col__large-3 and .l-col__small-4 to the first column and .l-col__large-9 and .l-col__small-4 to the second column. (For convenience sake we've also included .l-col__small--full as an equivalent to .l-col_small-4.

Setting fluid column position

Fluid columns can also be moved around in the row. This is useful so you can place the column with the primary content above all the others in the HTML, while displying it anywhere in the row. Essentially, the first column in the markup no longer has to be displayed on the left. To accomplish this, use the following move-left and move-right classes.

  • .l-col__large--move-left-1 through .l-col__large--move-left-12
  • .l-col__large--move-right-1 through .l-col__large--move-right-12
  • .l-col__small--move-left-1 through .l-col__small--move-left-4
  • .l-col__small--move-right-1 through .l-col__small--move-right-4

Consider a row with .l-col__large-8 .l-col__large-2 .l-col__large-2 in the HTML. Large-8 comes first, since it has the primary content. You can move large-8 around by adding the appropriate move classes to the columns. If you want to move large-8 to the right (between the two large-2 columns), you would apply .l-col__large--move-right-2 to large-8 and apply .l-col__large--move-left-10 to the first large-2 column. It needs to move left ten units-- eight units to go past large-8 and two more because we moved large-8 two units to the right. If you want to put large-8 on the right and the two large-2 columns on the left, apply .l-col__large--move-right-4 to large-8, apply .l-col__large--move-left-12 to the first large-2 column, and apply .l-col__large--move-left-10 to the second large-2 column.

Fixed columns

The fixed option (for now) assumes that you will use one fixed column and one flexible column (to fill the remaining 100% width). The fixed column currently comes in 5 sizes (each a multiple of 60px) + 1 at 160px:

  • .l-col__fixed-1 - 60px
  • .l-col__fixed-2 - 120px
  • .l-col__fixed-3 - 160px
  • .l-col__fixed-4 - 180px
  • .l-col__fixed-5 - 240px
  • .l-col__fixed-6 - 300px

Note that you must use the corresponding .l-col__flex class for the complementary column, so if you use .l-col__fixed-2 you should use .l-col__flex-2 with it.

Fixed columns on left or right

By default, fixed columns are floated to the left. If you want the fixed column to be on the right, modify it at the row level by adding .l-row__fixed--right. (There is an .l-row__fixed--left available as well.)

Fixed columns on both sides

Because rows are nestable, it's possible to create a layout with both fixed left and fixed right columns and a fluid center.

Flex column markup before fixed column

Note that by default with fixed columns, the fixed column markup must physically come before the flex column markup. If there is a need to reverse this, for example, the primary content will be in the flex column, that is possible. To place the flex column markup first, do the following. First, add the .l-col--flex-first modifier class to the .l-col__flex-<NUM> element. Then place an element with class .l-col__flex-content immediately inside it. All the flex column content should then go inside this content element. See the examples below.

Note on the letters in the examples

The letters included in each column allow you to see where the column is in the markup and which row a column belongs to, especially when switching between desktop and responsive.

  • The same letter is used in all columns of a row. For example, ("c1", "c2") are both in the same row.
  • The letters start at one ("g1") and increment the number for each new column ("g2", "g3", etc).
  • The letter instances are in order in the markup ("a1", "a2", "a3"), which does not always correspond to the order they are displayed in, for example if you use flex & fixed columns with .l-col--flex-first or if you use the move-left and move-right classes to reorder fluid columns.
I'm inlining the Javascript and hard-coded phrases since this is a dev-only help page and not intended for production in any sense.

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Anchor links

Note how there are no classes used on the anchor tag. This sheet also acts as a basic css reset for anchor tags.

Anchor tag link

Psuedo links

We prefer these pseudo links to using anchor tags because we can prevent right-click -> open in new tab/window. If we just had <a href='#'>link</a>, then the user could open a new link to just whatever page they're on. Which wouldn't make much sense.

Pseudo link with span tag and a fake javascript hook class.

When using a pseudo link (the .b-link class, it should always be accompanied by the .js-link class, which gives the pseudolink the same keyboard behavior as a real link, namely, you can use enter to activate the link after tabbing to it. It should also be accompanied by a tabindex attribute set to 0 tabindex="0" to insert it into the keyboard navigation order of the page.

Deciding between an anchor link and a pseudolink:

If the link leads to a new page, we should use an actual anchor link to allow the user to right-click and open in a new tab. If the link does something on-page (like sorting a column), then use the pseudo link to prevent opening in a new tab, which would just lead to a blank page.

See also: css_b_button.css for pseudo buttons

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Pseudo Links */ /** * For pseudo links. To avoid duplication, we're resetting the 'a' tag here. * we're also overriding jQuery UI's .ui-widget-content a rule. **/ a, a:active, a:visited, .b-link, .ui-widget-content a { color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color}; text-decoration: {vb:stylevar body_link_decoration}; } .b-link { cursor: pointer; } /* Override the cursor when the link is disabled. Unfortunately, these rules appear after the .h-disabeled rule. If the .h-disabled rule appeared after, we could just let .h-disabled override .b-link. */ .b-link.h-disabled { cursor: default; } /* Default hover state */ a:hover, .b-link:hover, .ui-widget-content a:hover { color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color_hover}; text-decoration: {vb:stylevar body_link_decoration_hover}; } END CSS RULES

Lists

A basic list starts with the .b-list class.
