To display an inline, comma-separated list using <ul> and <li> markup, add the .b-list and .b-list--commas classes to the <ul> element.

  • Item one
  • Item two
  • Item three
  • Item four
  • Item five
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* ***** The base list class ***** */ .b-list { Placeholder for now } /* ***** An inline, comma-separated list of values ***** */ .b-list--commas { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; } /* Using the li selector here doesn't strictly follow BEM philosophy, where everything should be based off exactly *one* class selector. I choose to use the BEM selector on the parent UL or OL element, and select the LI elements with two selectors to take advantage of the cascading nature of CSS. I am okay with this due to the tightly coupled nature of UL & LI elements, and it allows us to create a comma separated list without bloating the markup or CSS. */ .b-list--commas li { padding: 0; margin: 0; display: inline; } .b-list--commas li:after { content: ", "; } .b-list--commas li:last-child:after { content: ""; } /* Style the demo on special/css-examples */ .b-list--demo { border: 1px solid #ccc; padding: 10px; margin-bottom: 15px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Get to know and love the media object: http://bit.ly/cCY3Ew

BEM-style naming borrowed from Inuit CSS:
https://github.com/csswizardry/inuit.css/blob/master/inuit.css/objects/_media.scss

Example:

15 days
Neil deGrasse Tyson @neiltyson

Cutting PBS support (0.0.12% of budget) to help balance the Federal budget is like deleting text files to make room on your 500Gig hard drive.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /*-------------------------------------- * MEDIA OBJECT *------------------------------------*/ /* Apply a clearfix to the media element wrapper and the body */ .b-media, .b-media__body { overflow: hidden; _overflow: visible; zoom: 1; } /* Float an image (or text or whatever) to the left side */ .b-media__img { float: {vb:stylevar left}; } /* Float an optional bit of content to the right. */ .b-media__img--rev { float: {vb:stylevar right}; } /* Make sure things properly align (no hanging text under the image in the body). */ .b-media, .b-media__img img, .b-media__img--rev img, .b-media__body { display: block; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These CSS classes are for menu bar in the header At present this is not remotely the entire menu bar. This is just an attempt to untangle a bunch of logic for the user menu/login drop down which share code and styling despite being almost entirely distinct things I am creating a bucket for the entire menu because I think that there will eventually be substantial similarities we need to deal with

END DOCUMENTATION .b_menu__dropdown { position: relative; z-index:100; } We disable the entire top menu bar initially and when site builder is open. This violates BEM, but the .h-disabled occurs outside the code being refactored and involves javascript so for now we leave well enough alone .h-disabled .b_menu__dropdownbutton { cursor: default; } .b_menu__dropdown { height: 28px } .b_menu__dropdownbutton { display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; height: 100%; Matches padding on the Main Navigation bar elements #main-navbar ul li a padding-{vb:stylevar right}:10px; padding-{vb:stylevar left}:10px; font-weight: bold; outline:none; cursor:pointer; } .b_menu__dropdownbutton, .h-disabled .b_menu__dropdownbutton:hover { color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_disabled_color}; } .b_menu__dropdownbutton:hover { color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_color_hover}; } .b-menu__dropdown-foreground { z-index: 10; position: relative; height: 100%; } .b-menu__dropdown-background { z-index:5; position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; height: 27px; width: 100%; } The --alert class is toggled by JS at the parent level, not the button level. As such we look for the parent class to reduce JS complexity at the cost of longer selectors .b_menu__dropdown--alert .b-menu__dropdown-background { background-color: #cef5ff; } The JS will add the .b_menu__dropdown--active to the root of the dropdown and we'll use that to change the child elements. This violates BEM standards but is much cleaner than having the JS change a half dozen html entries to add a class everywhere that needs to change when the user clicks something. .b_menu__dropdown--active .b_menu__dropdownbutton, .b_menu__dropdown--active .b_menu__dropdownbutton:hover { color: #FFF; } .b_menu__dropdown--active { background: #878F93 url("images/css/sprite_gradients_vb.png") repeat-x scroll 0 -900px; } .b-menu__username-avatar { background: transparent; display: inline-block; margin-top: 4px; border: 1px solid #CECECE; max-height:18px; max-width:18px; } .b-menu__username-label { display: inline-block; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px; } .b-menu__username-iconcontainer { display: inline-block; width: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}:7px; height:100%; } .b-menu__dropdown-submenu { display: none; position: absolute; top: 28px; {vb:stylevar right}: 0; background: #F1F1F1; z-index: 1100; color: inherit; width:auto; min-width:99%; border:1px solid #B1B1B1; border-top:0; } .b-menu__username-submenu > li { float: none; white-space: nowrap; border-top:1px solid #FFF; border-bottom:1px solid #C6C7C7; line-height:30px; min-width:99%; } .b-menu__username-submenu > li:first-child { border-top:0; } Use class instead of psuedo attribute to make ie8 happy should change when IE8 support is dropped .b-menu__username-submenu > li.last-child { border-bottom:0; } .b-menu__username-submenu > li:hover { background:#C6C7C7; } #main-navbar included here for specificity only. If we don't have it something overrides these rules. This approach is better than !important. We should remove this once we refactor the menu code entirely so that we don't have wierd rules that conflict. #main-navbar .b-menu__username-submenu-link { color:#1B1B1B; font-weight:normal; line-height:30px; } #main-navbar .b-menu__username-submenu-link--bold-highlight { color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color}; font-weight: bold; } b-menu__messages-submenu--unread & b-menu__messages-submenu--unread-alert classes are added by javascript, not templates (pmchat.js) .b-menu__messages-submenu--unread { background:{vb:stylevar private_messages_mark_as_unread_background}; } 1) #main-navbar included here for specificity only, see note above for #main-navbar .b-menu__username-submenu-link 2) .b-menu__messages-submenu--unread is added at the parent level by JS. In order to avoid making the JS too complicated by adding/removing a separate BEM class to every added child that needs style changes, we add the relevant parent class here. #main-navbar .b-menu__messages-submenu--unread .b-menu__username-submenu-link { font-weight: bold; } .b-menu__messages-submenu--unread-alert { background: #cef5ff; } We'll resize this in the JS, but having some baselines in the css seems prudent .b-menu__login-iframe { min-height: 150px; min-width: 300px; } /* External Login Providers */ .b-menu__login-external { display: none; height:auto; line-height: 33px; background: #E0E0E0; border-top: 1px solid #FFF; float:none; clear:both; min-width:100%; } .b-menu__login-external-title { display:inline-block; vertical-align:middle; } The main rules for menus blow up what we are trying to do with the icons. We need to reapply some of hte basic icon styles here to get things to work. We'll apply it to the specific icon of interest to avoid potentially breaking other icons in the menu css that may have weird rules applied. This should be removed when the rest of the menu code is refactored. #main-navbar .b-menu__login-external-link { display:inline-block; padding:0; height:24px; /*must match the height of the icon*/ } .b-menu__login-external-link { vertical-align:middle; } .externalLoginEnabled .b-menu__login-iframe-container { border-bottom:1px solid #C6C7C7; } .externalLoginEnabled > .b-menu__login-external { display: block; } ** RESPONSIVE ** .l-xsmall .b_menu__dropdownbutton { Matches padding on the Main Navigation bar elements .l-xsmall #main-navbar ul li a padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; } .l-xsmall .b-menu__username-iconcontainer { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px; } .l-xsmall .b-menu__username-label { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px; Max width and the ellipsis class ensures that even with long usernames, the buttons will still fit in the top bar and will not spill out onto a second row. max-width: 78px; }

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * METER
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-meter {
	display: inline-block;
	/* GH: Previous code that may not be needed due to addition of inline-block.
	/ padding-{vb:stylevar left}:31px; */
}
.b-meter__bar {
	background: #E5E8E9;
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
	height: 10px;
	width: 4px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:2px;
}
.b-meter__bar--small {
	height: 7px;
	width: 3px;
}
.b-meter__bar--selected {
	background: {vb:stylevar post_rating_color} url(images/css/sprite_gradients_vb.png) repeat-x scroll 0 -650px;
}
.b-meter__bar:first-child {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:0;
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-module* classes will be used for modules. This is a work in progress.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-module { /* placeholder for now */ } /* Rules for the show_at_breakpoints config item These rules currently use 'body' in the selector because the l-small class gets added to the narrow columns in a layout even when not in responsive. See VBV-11460. Note: The "small" rules are first because the JS doesn't remove the "l-small" class when it adds "l-xsmall". */ Simple breakpoint rules body.l-desktop .b-module--hide-desktop { display: none; } body.l-small .b-module--hide-small { display: none; } body.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-xsmall { display: none; } Complex breakpoint rules (we can have .l-small and .l-xsmall simultaneously) /* remove any effect of hide-small if we are really in xsmall */ body.l-small.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-small { display: block; } /* re-hide in xsmall */ body.l-small.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-xsmall { display: none; } Fix borders, corner radius and spacing for contiguous modules .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .b-module--contiguous { border: {vb:stylevar module_content_border}; margin: -{vb:stylevar module_content_border.width}{vb:stylevar module_content_border.units} 0 0 0; } .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .has-adjacent-left-col .b-module--contiguous { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: -{vb:stylevar module_content_border.width}{vb:stylevar module_content_border.units}; } .view-mode.l-small .b-layout--contiguous .has-adjacent-left-col .b-module--contiguous { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .l-row.has-columns { margin-bottom: 15px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-pmchat* classes are used for various components of the PM Chat feature. This is a work in progress.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES Chat window related styles .b-pmchat__widget { background:{vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_widget_background}; } .b-pmchat__header { box-sizing: border-box; left: 0; position: fixed; z-index: 1; width: 100%; } .b-pmchat__header-inner { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_widget_background}; } .b-pmchat__content-wrapper { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background}; } .b-pmchat__thread-placeholder { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background}; color: {vb:stylevar text_tertiary_color}; top: 30%; position: relative; text-align: center; font-size: 200%; } .b-pmchat__thread-container { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background}; min-height: 300px; padding-bottom: 15px; /* 5px larger than the spacing between each message. This slightly larger padding helps the user know that they're at the bottom without having to check the scrollbar */ } Chat Window - Participants List .b-pmchat__participants { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_participants_background}; white-space: nowrap; -webkit-border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} 0 0; -moz-border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} 0 0; border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} 0 0; } .b-pmchat__participants-label { font-weight: bold; color: {vb:stylevar text_tertiary_color}; } .b-pmchat__participants-avatar { width: auto; height: 42px; vertical-align: middle; display: inline-block; border: {vb:stylevar activity_stream_avatar_border}; box-sizing: border-box; } Chat Window - Participants List - Scroll Bar This is a copy of the "Tiny scrollbars jQuery plugin styles" section from css_sitebuilder.css with minor adjustments for the PM Chat Window (mostly some margins, track color & thumb icon). The ".b-pmchat__participants" in the selector is only required because currently the sitebuilder css loads for admins, and that overrides this section without the additional class selector. .viewport, .overview, .scroller, .scrollbar, .track & .thumb don't conform to BEM, but they are classes needed for the tinyscrollbar plugin. .b-pmchat__participants .viewport { overflow: hidden; position: relative; } .b-pmchat__participants .viewport .overview { padding: 0; margin: 0; position: relative; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; top: 0; } .b-pmchat__participants .scroller { overflow: hidden; width: 100%; } .b-pmchat__participants .scrollbar { position: relative; margin: 10px 0 10px 0; clear: both; height: 4px; width: 100%; } .b-pmchat__participants .scrollbar .track { cursor: pointer; height:4px; position: relative; background: #e1e1e1; -moz-border-radius: 2px; -webkit-border-radius: 2px; border-radius: 2px; } .b-pmchat__participants .scrollbar .thumb { width:14px; height: 14px; cursor: pointer; position: absolute; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; top: 50%; margin-top:-7px; background: transparent url(images/css/sprite_icons_ltr.png) no-repeat scroll -176px -144px; } .b-pmchat__participants .scrollbar.disable { visibility: hidden; height: 0; margin: 0; } End Tiny scrollbars jQuery plugin styles .b-pmchat__content-entry-wrapper { position: fixed; left: 0; bottom: 0; width: 100%; -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; } .b-pmchat__content-entry-inner { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_widget_background}; } .b-pmchat__content-entry { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background}; -webkit-border-radius: 0 0 {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size}; -moz-border-radius: 0 0 {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size}; border-radius: 0 0 {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tab_border_radius_size}; } .b-pmchat__feather { height: 30px; } .b-pmchat__feather--up { background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0), {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}); background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0), {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}); background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0), {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}); } .b-pmchat__feather--down { background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)); background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)); background: linear-gradient(to bottom, {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background.color}, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)); } ***** Content Columns (Avatar - Message - Avatar) ***** .b-pmchat__avatar-column { width: 42px; padding-top: 8px; } .b-pmchat__avatar-column--theirs { float: {vb:stylevar left}; } .b-pmchat__avatar-column--mine { float: {vb:stylevar right}; } .b-pmchat__content-column { Stylevars not needed, since we're setting both left and right to the same value. 42px avatar column width + 5px margin-left: 47px; margin-right: 47px; } ***** RESPONSIVE (Small) ***** .l-small .b-pmchat__content-entry { padding-bottom: 5px; } /* Avatar & content columns */ .l-small .b-pmchat__avatar-column { width: 30px; padding-top: 5px; } .l-small .b-pmchat__content-column { Stylevars not needed, since we're setting both left and right to the same value. 30px avatar column width + 5px margin-left: 35px; margin-right: 35px; } ***** RESPONSIVE (Extra Small) ***** .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__header { position: static; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__header-inner { padding: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__participants { -webkit-border-radius: 0; -moz-border-radius: 0; border-radius: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__feather { display: none; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__widget { padding: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-wrapper { -webkit-border-radius: 0; -moz-border-radius: 0; border-radius: 0; padding-top: 1px; padding-bottom: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-entry-inner { background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background}; padding-bottom: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__thread-container { min-height: 150px; } /* Avatar & content columns */ .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__avatar-column { width: 18px; padding-top: 11px; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-column { Stylevars not needed, since we're setting both left and right to the same value. 18px avatar column width + 5px margin-left: 23px; margin-right: 23px; } /* Hide "my" avatar at the smallest responsive size */ .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__avatar-column--mine { display: none; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-column { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-entry-wrapper { position: static; left: auto; bottom: auto; padding: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-pmchat__content-entry { -webkit-border-radius: 0; -moz-border-radius: 0; border-radius: 0; padding: 0 0 10px 0; } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * POST
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-post {
	border: {vb:stylevar post_border};
	margin-top: 10px;
	width: 100%;
	-moz-border-radius: 3px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 3px;
	border-radius: 3px;
	padding-bottom: 0;
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_background};
	position: relative;
	<vb:comment>Needs border-box because it's 100% wide and has borders, otherwise it will be a couple pixels wider than the other elements on the layout.</vb:comment>
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	box-sizing: border-box;
}

.b-post--pmchat {
	border: none;
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background};
}

.b-post__body {
	position: relative;
	background:{vb:stylevar thread_reply_background};
	-moz-border-radius:3px;
	-webkit-border-radius:3px;
	border-radius:3px;
}

.b-post__body--pmchat {
	border-radius: 7px;
	<vb:comment>Stylevars not needed, since we're setting both left and right to the same value.</vb:comment>
	margin-left: 10px;
	margin-right: 10px;
}

.b-post__body--pmchat-mine {
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_mine_background}; 
	border-color: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_mine_background.color}; 
}

.b-post__body--pmchat-theirs {
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_theirs_background}; 
	border-color: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_theirs_background.color}; 
}

.b-post__arrow {
	position: absolute;
	top:35px;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px solid {vb:stylevar thread_reply_background.backgroundColor};
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	{vb:stylevar left}: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar right}: auto;
}

.b-post__arrow--pmchat {
	top: 25px;
}

.b-post__arrow--left {
	border-right: 10px solid;
	border-right-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-left: 0px;
	left: -10px;
	right: auto;
}

.b-post__arrow--right {
	border-left: 10px solid;
	border-left-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-right: 0px;
	left: auto;
	right: -10px;
}

.b-post__title {
	font-size: 16px;
	font-weight: bold;
}

.b-post__stream-post-title {
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* when displaying post the footer should not have any margin (VBV-12195) */
.blog-list .b-post__footer {
	/* not using left/right stylevars, since we're setting the same margin on both */
	margin-left: 0;
	margin-right: 0;
}

<vb:comment>
/* TODO:
 *
 * The !important declaration is needed here because during the transition to
 * the new CSS framework we're having to overcoming a hierarchy of rules. The
 * !important should be able to be removed when we're done.
 **/
</vb:comment>
.b-post__count,
.b-post__timestamp {
	color:{vb:stylevar time_stamp_color} !important;
}

.b-post__count {
	font-size: 12px;
}

.b-post__timestamp {
	font-size: 11px;
}

.b-post .l-col__fixed {
	padding-top:15px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}:25px;
	padding-bottom:15px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}:15px;
}


.b-post .b-divider--section {
	display: none;
}

.b-post__date {
	font-size: 11px;
	color:{vb:stylevar time_stamp_color};
	line-height: 20px;
	text-align: {vb:stylevar left};
}


.b-post__label {
	border: 1px solid #5F6A6F;
	height: 12px;
	line-height: 12px;
	margin-top: 8px;
	float: {vb:stylevar left};
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
	padding: 1px 4px;
	color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color};
	font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
	font-size: 10px;
	display: inline-block;
}

.b-post .b-post-attachments {
	margin-top: 10px;
}


.b-post--unapproved .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background.color};
}

.b-post--unapproved .b-post__body {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background};
}

.b-post--first .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};
}

.b-post--first .b-post__body {
	background: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background};
}

.b-post--deleted {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_deleted_background};
}

.b-post--deleted .b-comments,
.b-post--deleted .b-post__footer,
.b-post--deleted .b-post__hide-when-deleted {
	display: none;
}

.b-post--deleted .b-divider--section {
	display: block;
}

<vb:comment>This comes after b-post--deleted to override it.</vb:comment>
.b-post--show-deleted-content .b-post__hide-when-deleted {
	display: block;
}


<vb:comment>
	Inline moderation hilghight should always override the other colors.
	@TODO: Rename .inlinemod_highlight when we redo inlinemod CSS. And use a proper stylevar!
</vb:comment>
.inlinemod_highlight .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: #D6E8EF;
}

.inlinemod_highlight .b-post__body {
	background: #D6E8EF;
}

.b-post__unpublish-info {
	min-height: 52px;
	font-size: 12px;
	min-height: 52px;
	line-height: 16px;
}

.b-post__content {
	font: {vb:stylevar post_content_font};
}

.b-post__content--edit,
.b-post__footer--edit {
	display: none;
}
.b-post__content .post-signature {
	border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar post_controls_divider_color};
	margin-top: 0px;
	padding-top: 15px;
}

.b-post__edit {
	font-style: italic;
	clear: {vb:stylevar left};
}

.b-post__history {
	cursor: pointer;
}

.b-post__article-meta-wrapper .avatar-sm,
.b-post__article-meta-wrapper .avatar-sm img {
	height: 16px;
	width: 16px;
}

.b-post__article-meta {
	color: {vb:stylevar time_stamp_color};
	font-size: 12px;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item {
	line-height: 14px;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item .avatar {
	margin: 0;
	width: 14px;
	height: 14px;
	display: inline;
	vertical-align: middle;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item a {
	vertical-align: middle;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item--inline {
	display: inline;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 8px;
}

.b-post__not-published-notice {
	color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_login_error_text_color}; /* this stylevar should be renamed to warning_color or similar*/
}

<vb:comment>
/* Ordinarily I'd want to handle this with a helper on the
 * content-entry div, but not knowing what other dependencies
 * there might be, we're situationally adding the margin when it's
 * inside an editable post */
</vb:comment>
.b-post--edit .b-content-entry {
	margin-bottom: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_xl};
}

.b-post--edit .b-toolbar {
	max-height: 44px;
	/* overflow: hidden; */
}


<vb:comment>
/*
 * The b-post--preview modifier is added to the container of a post being
 * displayed in a dialog. We use a bit of selector inheritance to constrain
 * the rules, but use generalized modifier classes to adjust the behavior of
 * multiple elements, so that the intent (e.g. h-hide--on-preview) is
 * understood by looking at the HTML template, rather than trying to capture
 * all of the normal CSS class names in these rules.
 *
 * Because it's a modifier and we need to be assured of overriding rules,
 * this is a case when use of !important is acceptable.
 **/
</vb:comment>

.b-post--preview .h-hide--on-preview {
	display: none;
}

.b-post--preview .h-restore--on-preview {
	margin: 0 !important;
	padding: 0 !important;
	border: none !important;
	-moz-border-radius: 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 0;
	border-radius: 0;
	background: inherit !important;
}

.b-post__preview-image {
	border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar post_border.borderColor};
}

<vb:comment> In the responsive view, point the arrow upwards. </vb:comment>
.l-small .b-post__arrow {
	top: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: 39px;
	border-bottom: 10px solid {vb:stylevar thread_reply_background.backgroundColor};
	border-top: none;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 6px solid transparent;
}

.l-small .b-post--unapproved .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background.color};
}

.l-small .b-post--first .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};
}

.l-small .inlinemod_highlight .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: #D6E8EF;
}

.l-small .b-post__arrow--pmchat {
	top: 15px;
}

<vb:comment>Maintain left & right arrow directions in responsive</vb:comment>
.l-small .b-post__arrow--left {
	border-right: 10px solid;
	border-right-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-left: 0px;
	left: -10px;
	right: auto;
}

.l-small .b-post__arrow--right {
	border-left: 10px solid;
	border-left-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-right: 0px;
	left: auto;
	right: -10px;
}

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This block is used for attachments shown as a list in posts (as opposed to inline). This is not related to css_b_attach_item.css.

{vb:set attachmentCount, {vb:php range, 1, 5}} {vb:set attachment.filename, {vb:concat 'Attachment ', {vb:raw index}}} {vb:set attachment.filesize, '100 KB'} {vb:set attachment.counter, '1000'} {vb:set attachments.$index, {vb:raw attachment}}
Use the restore class to mimic posts. {vb:template bbcode_attachment_list, attachments={vb:raw attachments}}
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Attachment List */ .b-post-attachments { padding: 5px 5px 5px 9px; color: {vb:stylevar module_tab_text_color}; /*margin-top: 10px;*/ -moz-border-radius: 3px; -webkit-border-radius: 3px; border-radius: 3px; border: {vb:stylevar post_border}; background: #F6F6F6; /*max-width: 40%; VBV-11653*/ clear: both; } .b-post-attachments .b-post-attachments__item { /* This is overly specific to override our restore rules... */ list-style: none; } .b-post-attachments .b-post-attachments__item img{ padding: 0px 1px 1px 0px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-post-column classes are used for the "Display Columns" when displaying the article list in a category.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-post-column__two, .b-post-column__three { margin: 0; -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; } /* The three longer selectors below allow overriding the width/margin set for .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item without using !important, as would otherwise have to be done when setting these values in the individual classes in this file */ .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item.b-post-column__two { width: 49%; } .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item.b-post-column__three { width: 32%; } .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item.b-post-column__three--second { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 2%; } .b-post-column__two--first { float: {vb:stylevar left}; clear: both; } .b-post-column__two--second { float: {vb:stylevar right}; clear: none; } .b-post-column__three--first { float: {vb:stylevar left}; clear: both; } .b-post-column__three--second { float: {vb:stylevar left}; clear: none; } .b-post-column__three--third { float: {vb:stylevar right}; clear: none; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Post Controls are the little action links with icons at the bottom of the post. They include:

  • Infractions
  • Edit
  • Flag
  • Quote
  • Comment
  • Like / Unlike
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /*-------------------------------------- * POST CONTROLS *------------------------------------*/ .b-post-control { display: inline-block; float: {vb:stylevar left}; color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color}; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 10px; position: relative; padding: 1px 4px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 3px; cursor: pointer; } .b-post-control, .b-post-control__icon, .b-post-control__label { vertical-align: middle; } .b-post-control__label { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 2px; } .b-post-control__bubble-flyout-container { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 26px; } .b-post-control__bubble-flyout { position: absolute; {vb:stylevar right}: -26px; {vb:stylevar left}: auto; top: -1px; background: white; /* Override the responsive button color. */ color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color}; } .b-post-control--disabled { cursor:auto; } .l-small .b-post-control--responsive { color: #fff; background-color: #2379B5; -moz-border-radius: 2px; -webkit-border-radius: 2px; border-radius: 2px; height: 18px; line-height: 18px; padding: 0 0.8em; } .l-small .b-post-control__label { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .l-small .b-post-control--responsive .b-post-control__icon { display: none; } We still want the color to apply in the responsive view, so this comes after. .b-post-control__quote--selected .b-post-control__label { color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_quote_active_text_color}; } END CSS RULES

The b-post-sm block displays a post in the Search Module.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-post-sm { margin-top: 15px; padding-top: 15px; border-top: {vb:stylevar module_search_list_item_border}; } .b-post-sm--compact { margin-top: 0; padding-top: 0; border-top: none; } .b-post-sm:first-child { padding-top: 0; border-top: none; } .b-post-sm__avatar { /* */ } .b-post-sm__content { /* */ } .b-post-sm__title { font-weight: bold; } .b-post-sm__author { /* */ } .b-post-sm__desc { /* */ } .b-post-sm__post-content { /* */ } .b-post-sm__content--has-avatar { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 44px; } .b-post-sm__footer { /* */ } .b-post-sm__date { font-size: 11px; color: {vb:stylevar time_stamp_color}; text-align: {vb:stylevar right}; } END CSS RULES

</vb:comment>

.b-pseudowidget.canvas-widget {
	border: {vb:stylevar module_content_border};

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-tabbed-pane block is a common construct consisting of a series of tabs (configurable in horizontal or vertical configurations) that have a selected state corresponding to a "pane", or associated content area.

The prescribed structure for a Tabbed Pane is:

  • .b-tabbed-pane
    • .b-tabbed-pane__tabs
      • .b-tabbed-pane__tab.b-tabbed-pane__tab--selected
      • .b-tabbed-pane__tab
      • .b-tabbed-pane__tab
      • .b-tabbed-pane__pane.b-tabbed-pane__pane--selected
      • .b-tabbed-pane__pane
      • .b-tabbed-pane__pane

For additional styling, you can add a --modifier class. The initial implementation of the underlined tabs for User Settings puts the modifier on the individual tab, but it seems feasible to apply it at tho top level and apply descendent selectors from that if desired.

Note that the functionality whereupon clicking a tab triggers its selection and the display of the corresponding pane is implemented in JavaScript (see js/css_b_tabbed_pane.js). This includes an option for responsive handling of tab display, in which the tabs get stacked vertically (via a --stacked modifier) when the horizontal row breaks to a new line. This is currently not turned on by default, though we may want to consider reversing that as we implement other tabs.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Apply a simple clearfix to the tabs */ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs:before, .b-tabbed-pane__tabs:after { content: ' '; display: table; } .b-tabbed-pane__tabs:after { clear: both; } /* In its base configuration, tabs does not currently have * any styling or rules applied. However, its structure is desired * in order to house the horizontally-oriented individual tab elements.*/ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs { } /* Individual tab item, defaulted to a horizontal orientation */ .b-tabbed-pane__tab { list-style: none; float: {vb:stylevar left}; } /* Display the tag inside a tab as an inline block. */ .b-tabbed-pane__tab-link { display: inline-block; } /* By default, set panes to be hidden. */ .b-tabbed-pane__pane { display: none; } /* In order to display a pane, add a pane-specific selected class. * * TODO: Upon implementing a second set of tabbed panes, pull out * styles listed below that were copied straight from the User Settings tabs.*/ .b-tabbed-pane__pane.b-tabbed-pane__pane--selected { display: block; background: {vb:stylevar form_background}; border: {vb:stylevar form_border}; min-height:101px; padding:0; -moz-border-radius:0 3px 3px 3px; -webkit-border-radius:0 3px 3px 3px; border-radius:0 3px 3px 3px; } /*=================== * Underlined Tabs *===================*/ .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline { border-bottom: 4px solid transparent; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; } /* Apply the unselected color to links within each tab */ .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline > .b-tabbed-pane__tab-link { color:#8D9FA7; } /* Add the underline styling to the selected tab */ .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline.b-tabbed-pane__tab--selected { border-bottom: {vb:stylevar profile_settings_tab_highlight}; } /* Override the link color for the selected tab's link */ .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline.b-tabbed-pane__tab--selected > .b-tabbed-pane__tab-link { color: #252C2F; cursor: default; } /*============= * Stacked Tabs *=============*/ /** * For tabs with stacked modifier, stretch them to full-width * and remove their float **/ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs--stacked .b-tabbed-pane__tab { display: block; width: 100%; float: none; -webkit-box-sizing: border-box; -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; } /** * Set behavior for underline tabs when stacked **/ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs--stacked .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline { border: {vb:stylevar form_border}; border-bottom: none; padding-left: 3px; } /** * Make the tab link stretch the entire width for more friendly clickability. **/ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs--stacked .b-tabbed-pane__tab-link { display: block; width: 100%; } /* Set underline to the left when tabs are stacked */ .b-tabbed-pane__tabs--stacked .b-tabbed-pane__tab--underline.b-tabbed-pane__tab--selected { border-{vb:stylevar left}: {vb:stylevar profile_settings_tab_highlight}; padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These CSS classes are for the theme selection tab in the style panel in sitebuilder

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-theme-selector { } .b-theme-selector__container { margin: 50px 0 20px 0; } /* .scroller and .scrollbar don't conform to BEM, but they are classes needed for the tinyscrollbar plugin. */ .b-theme-selector__container .scroller { width: 100%; } .b-theme-selector__container .scrollbar { margin-top: 80px; } .b-theme-selector__list { width: 695px; } .b-theme-selector__message { width: 100%; padding: 60px 0; text-align: center; font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; } .b-theme-selector__message img { margin-top: 5px; } .b-theme-selector__theme { width: 112px; height: 150px; float: {vb:stylevar left}; position: relative; } .b-theme-selector__theme-thumbnail { border: 1px solid transparent; } .b-theme-selector__theme-thumbnail img, .b-theme-selector__theme-thumbnail .b-theme-selector__image-resize-wrapper { -webkit-box-shadow: 1px 1px 3px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.75); -moz-box-shadow: 1px 1px 3px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.75); box-shadow: 1px 1px 3px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.75); display: block; } .b-theme-selector__theme-radio { visibility: hidden; position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .b-theme-selector__theme--selected .b-theme-selector__theme-thumbnail, .b-theme-selector__theme:hover .b-theme-selector__theme-thumbnail { /* This color matches the hard-coded border / background color used elsewhere in sitebuilder for the hover / selected color of items in a horizontal scrolling list (screen layouts, page templates, etc.) TODO move this to a stylevar and replace all instances of it in sitebuilder CSS with the stylevar at the same time. */ border: 1px solid #467D96; background: #467D96; -moz-border-radius:3px; -webkit-border-radius:3px; border-radius:3px; } .b-theme-selector__theme-title { height: 32px; overflow: hidden; text-align: center; /* This color matches the hard-coded text color used elsewhere in sitebuilder for the title of items in a horizontal scrolling list (screen layouts, page templates, etc.) TODO move this to a stylevar and replace all instances of it in sitebuilder CSS with the stylevar */ color: #4DCDFF; } .b-theme-selector__theme-preview { position: relative; min-height: 225px; } /* This allows us to position the preview in the left column in the quick setup panel. */ .b-theme-selector__quick-setup-wrapper { position: relative; } .b-theme-selector__quick-setup-wrapper .b-theme-selector__theme-preview { position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: -315px; width: 275px; } /* This shouldn't use the #admin-stylepanel-themes selector, but it's needed for now to override the styles applied by the global sitebuilder CSS to paragraphs in the panel header text. */ #admin-stylepanel-themes .b-theme-selector__theme-preview-message, .b-theme-selector__theme-preview-message { border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar inline_edit_search_bar_background.backgroundColor}; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; padding: 85px 10px 90px 10px; } .b-theme-selector__theme-preview img { border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar inline_edit_search_bar_background.backgroundColor}; position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-toggle-slider block displays a pair of Yes/No radio buttons with some Yes/No slider eye candy. To use it, include the template toggle_slider. Here are some examples.

{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button', checked='yes'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button', checked='yes'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button2', checked='yes', yesLabel={vb:phrase on}, noLabel={vb:phrase off}}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button2', checked='yes', yesLabel={vb:phrase on}, noLabel={vb:phrase off}}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button3', checked='no'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button3', checked='no'}
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES There are various colors hard-coded in this file. They were copied from the .switch-control class definitions. They should be assigned stylevars and changed together. In the future, .switch-control should be replaced by .b-toggle-slider. .b-toggle-slider__wrapper { min-width: 90px; } .b-toggle-slider { position: relative; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; border: {vb:stylevar main_nav_button_border}; font-size: 12px; min-width: 34px; height: 18px; cursor: pointer; -moz-border-radius: 2px; -webkit-border-radius: 2px; border-radius: 2px; -webkit-touch-callout: none; -webkit-user-select: none; -khtml-user-select: none; -moz-user-select: none; -ms-user-select: none; user-select: none; } .b-toggle-slider__label { line-height: 18px; min-width: 16px; text-align: center; padding: 0 5px; position: relative; } .b-toggle-slider__label--yes { float: {vb:stylevar right}; background: #2183C3 url("images/css/sprite_gradients_vb.png") repeat-x scroll 0 -1050px; color: #FFF; } .b-toggle-slider__label--no { float: {vb:stylevar left}; background: #E0E4E5 url("images/css/sprite_gradients_vb.png") repeat-x scroll 0 -1100px; color: #727272; } .b-toggle-slider__handle { background: #F9FAFA url("images/css/sprite_gradients_vb.png") repeat-x scroll 0 -1075px; display: inline-block; height: 100%; width: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; -moz-border-radius: 2px; -webkit-border-radius: 2px; border-radius: 2px; } .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes { {vb:stylevar right}: 0; border-{vb:stylevar left}: 1px solid #AEAEAE; } .b-toggle-slider__handle--no { {vb:stylevar left}: 0; border-{vb:stylevar right}: 1px solid #AEAEAE; } .b-toggle-slider--yes .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes, .b-toggle-slider--no .b-toggle-slider__handle--no { display: none; } .b-toggle-slider--yes .b-toggle-slider__handle--no, .b-toggle-slider--no .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes { display: inline-block; } .b-toggle-slider__radio { position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; visibility: hidden; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These classes are used as "hooks" to allow setting a background color or image across various elements in the header area.

  • .b-top-background__header-mainnav allows setting the background for the "header" element and the main navigation tabs.
  • .b-top-background__header-mainnav-subnav allows setting the background for the "header" element, the main navigation tabs, and the secondary navigation tabs.
  • NOTE: #header allows setting the background for just the "header" element (where the logo is).
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-top-background { /* placeholder */ } .b-top-background__header-mainnav { background: {vb:stylevar topbg_header_mainnav_background}; border-bottom: {vb:stylevar topbg_header_mainnav_bottom_border}; A max width stylevar can be added here if/when needed. } .b-top-background__header-mainnav-subnav { background: {vb:stylevar topbg_header_mainnav_subnav_background}; A bottom border stylevar can be added here if/when needed. max-width: {vb:stylevar topbg_header_mainnav_subnav_max_width}; margin: auto; } END CSS RULES

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * USER INFO
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-userinfo {
	text-align: center;
	color: {vb:stylevar post_user_info_color};
	padding: 15px 15px 10px;
}

.b-userinfo--pmchat {
	display: inline-block;
}

.b-userinfo__rank {
	/* TODO: is this really the stylevar we want to use? */
	color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color};
}

.b-userinfo__icons {
	position: absolute;
	bottom: 10px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;
}

.b-userinfo__icon {
	text-align: center;
	width: 16px;
	height: 16px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 4px;
}

.b-userinfo__icon:last-child {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo {
	text-align: {vb:stylevar left};
	padding: 10px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo .b-avatar,
.l-small .b-userinfo__details,
.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info {
	display: inline-block;
	vertical-align: top;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo .b-avatar {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__details .b-meter,
.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info-block {
	margin-top: 5px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__icons {
	top: 10px;
	bottom: auto;
	{vb:stylevar left}: auto;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
}

<vb:comment>/* 
	Viewport rules to compliment the meta viewport tag (keep them in sync)
	These need to come before any media queries
*/</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>/* IE11 and Edge */</vb:comment>
@-ms-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Opera Mini */</vb:comment>
@-o-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Not supported by default, but can be enabled in Chrome */</vb:comment>
@-webkit-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Not yet supported by Firefox, but we can hope */</vb:comment>
@-moz-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
@viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}

html {
	<vb:comment>
		The above @-ms-viewport rule triggers IE11's autohiding scrollbars,
		which appear when you mouse over the page or scroll it. The issue is that
		the scrollbars obscure content and make any links/buttons near the right edge
		difficult or impossible to click. This rule ensures we always display
		"traditional" scrollbars that take up space from the viewport, but that don't
		obscure any content. See VBV-16177. This is a workaround for the fact that
		the viewport rule causes the autohiding scrollbars to be used.
	</vb:comment>
	-ms-overflow-style: scrollbar;
}


<vb:comment>/* NOTE: Some common CSS rules were taken out of css_global.css template and moved to css_reset.css, css_unreset.css and css_utilities.css */</vb:comment>
.warning .text {
	padding:5px;
}
.ellipsis br,
.ellipsis hr {
	display:none;
}
.ellipsis.multiline {
	white-space: normal;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container {
	display:none;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container:first-child {
	display:inline;
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
	width:100%;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container:first-child,
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_quote > .quote_container {
	overflow: hidden;
	text-overflow: ellipsis;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_description,
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_code,
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_quote > .quote_container > .bbcode_postedby,
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_quote > .quote_container > .message {
	display:inline;
	white-space:nowrap;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_quote > .quote_container > .message {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:8px;
}
.ellipsis .bbcode_container > .bbcode_quote {
	margin-bottom:0;
}
.ellipsis.restore li,
.ellipsis.restore * + ul,
.ellipsis.restore * + ol,
.ellipsis.restore .text_table_ {
	display:none;
}
.ellipsis.restore > .text_table_ {
	display:block;
}
<vb:comment> <div align="xxxx"> may be produced by ckeditor or by copy-pasted rich text</vb:comment>
.ellipsis.restore div[align] {
	display: inline-block;
}
.ellipsis.restore ol > li:first-child,
.ellipsis.restore ul > li:first-child {
	display:list-item;
}
.ellipsis.restore ol,
.ellipsis.restore ul,
.ellipsis.restore table {
	margin-bottom: 0;
	margin-top: 0;
}
.see-more {
	font-size: 10px;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-transform: uppercase;
}
.scrolltofixed {
	{vb:stylevar left}:0;
	{vb:stylevar right}:auto;
	width:100%;
	position:fixed !important;
	z-index:100 !important;
}
.scrolltofixed.scrolltofixed-top {
	top:0;
}
.scrolltofixed.scrolltofixed-bottom {
	bottom:0;
}
.ie7 .table.center-vertical .td .td-content-wrapper,
.ie7 .table .td.center-vertical .td-content-wrapper
{
	position:relative !important;
	top:-50% !important;
}
#vb-page-body .body-text {
	font-size:13px;
}

<vb:comment>
/**************************************************************************
 * Canvas Layout and Widgets
 **************************************************************************/




/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget {
*/
</vb:comment>
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget {
	border: {vb:stylevar module_content_border};
	background: {vb:stylevar module_content_background};
	padding:15px;
	margin:0 0 16px 0;
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
	width:100%;
	position:relative;
	min-height:24px;
	height:auto;
	-moz-box-sizing:border-box;
	-webkit-box-sizing:border-box;
	box-sizing:border-box;
	-moz-border-radius:3px;
	-webkit-border-radius:3px;
	border-radius:3px;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.conversation-content-widget,
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.channel-content-widget {
*/
</vb:comment>
.conversation-content-widget,
.channel-content-widget {
	background: {vb:stylevar primary_module_background};
}

<vb:comment>
/********************************************************************
 * Widget Header
 ********************************************************************/
</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-header {
*/
</vb:comment>
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header {
	height:auto;
	min-height:28px;
	line-height:22px;
	margin:-15px;
	margin-bottom:0;
	position:relative;
	background:{vb:stylevar module_header_background};
}
.widget-header-divider {
	border: none;
	border-width: 0;
	border-top: {vb:stylevar module_header_border};
	margin: {vb:stylevar module_header_divider_margin};
}
<vb:comment>
/***************************************************************************
 * View Mode: What is it?
 *
 * Per Glenn, the .view-mode class is used to prevent rules on generic widget
 * items from being applied when in .edit-mode. So the rules below applied in
 * .view-mode will only have an effect on the widget  in its normal state, and
 * will not cascade to both states.
 ***************************************************************************/

/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border > .widget-header {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-no-border > .widget-header {
	background: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_background};
	color: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_font};
	border: 0;
	margin: 0;
	min-height: 0;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border > .widget-content {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-no-border > .widget-content {
	padding:0;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-header > .widget-header {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-no-header > .widget-header {
	display: none;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-no-border {
	width:100% !important;
	border: 0px none;
	-moz-border-radius: 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 0;
	border-radius: 0;
	padding: 0;
	margin-top: 0;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0;
	background: {vb:stylevar primary_module_background};
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.collapsed .widget-header {
*/
</vb:comment>
.collapsed .widget-header {
	/*border-bottom: 0;*/
	margin-top: -11px;
}


<vb:comment>
/****************************************************************
 * Widget Content
 ****************************************************************/
</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-content {
*/
</vb:comment>
.widget-content {
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
	margin:0;
	padding:0;
	width:100%;
}


<vb:comment>
/****************************************************************************
 * Widget Header Outside
 ***************************************************************************/
</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-header-outside {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-header-outside {
	margin-top: 25px;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-header-outside .widget-header {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-header-outside .widget-header {
	position: relative;
	margin-top: -65px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: -32px;
	border-bottom: 0;
	background:transparent;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-header-outside .widget-content {
*/
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .widget-header-outside .widget-content {
	padding-top: 0;
}


.conversation-starter .bubble-flyout u {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color:{vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};
}
<vb:comment>

/***************************************************************************
 * Search Container
 **************************************************************************/

</vb:comment>
.search-container {
	margin:17px 0 14px;
}
#header .toolbar .search-container {
	margin-top:0;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:0;
	margin-bottom:0;
}
.search-container .search-box {
	position:relative;
}
.search-container .search-box .search-term {
	height:18px;
	border-color:#1C1C21;
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}:5px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}:26px;
	padding-top:3px;
	padding-bottom:3px;
	margin:0;
	width:168px;
	color: {vb:stylevar header_search_input_text_color};

.popupControl{
	cursor: pointer;
	display: inline-block;
}
.popupContent{
	position: absolute;
	width:99%;
	z-index:100;
	border:1px solid #1C1C21;
	display:none;
	top:26px;
	{vb:stylevar right}:0;
	background:#F0F1F2;

	-webkit-border-radius: 0 0 2px 2px;
	border-radius: 0 0 2px 2px;
}
.search-container #searchPopupControl,
.search-result-header .PopupControl{
	cursor: pointer;
	display: inline-block;
	height: 20px;
}
.search-container #searchPopupControl{
	{vb:stylevar right}: 35px;
	position: absolute;
	top: 3px;
	width:20px;
}
.search-result-header .PopupControl{

}
.vb-icon-arrow-down-small {

	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 9px;

}

	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px;
	margin-top: 5px;
}
.search-container #searchPopupContent,
.search-result-header .PopupContent{

	width:97.5%;
	z-index:100;
	border:1px solid #BDBDBD;
	display:none;
	top:26px;
	{vb:stylevar left}:0;
	background:#F1F1F1;
	color: #1B1B1B;

}
.search-result-header .PopupContent{
	position: absolute;
	width:auto;

	display:none;
	top:18px;

	{vb:stylevar left}:0px;
	border: {vb:stylevar popup_border};

	-webkit-border-radius:2px;
	border-radius:2px;

Remove filter to avoid IE9 border-radius and background gradient bleeding bug.
This occurs in all custom dropdowns but only noticeable when dropdown is in a container with a dark background color or image (e.g. footer)
So let's just remove the filter in the custom dropdowns in the footer.
</vb:comment>

	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	box-sizing: border-box;
}

	float: {vb:stylevar left};
	padding: 0;
	color: {vb:stylevar breadcrumb_text_color};
}

#breadcrumbs .separator {
	float: {vb:stylevar left};
	height: 7px;
	margin: 5px 6px 4px;

	background-position:-368px -112px;
}

	margin-bottom:15px;

	visibility:hidden;
	display:block;
	float:none;

.autocomplete-container {
	border: 1px solid #C0C0C0;

	-webkit-border-radius:3px;
	border-radius:3px;
}

.autocomplete-box{

}

}
.tag-box .tag,

.search-control-popup .removable-element {

}
.search-control-popup .removable-element {

}
.search-controls-tags .tag-list {

}

.autocomplete-box .autocomplete .element-text {

<vb:comment>

.removable-element .element-x {
*/
</vb:comment>

.removable-element .element-x {
	position: absolute;
	top: 50%;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 3px;
	margin-top:-5px;

}
.autocompleteHelper {
	margin: 0 5px 5px 0;
	border: none !important;
	display: block;
	background: transparent;
	outline:none !important;

	box-shadow: 2px 2px 4px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
	/* For IE 8 */
	-ms-filter: "progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.Shadow(Strength=4, Direction=135, Color='#CCCCCC')";
	<vb:comment>Use border box so when we resize the dialog to the viewport width in responsive, we don't trigger a horizontal scrollbar because we're 2 pixels off due to the 1px border.</vb:comment>
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;
	box-sizing: border-box;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog {
	padding:0;
	-moz-border-radius: 3px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 3px;
	border-radius: 3px;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar {
	border-width: 0 0 1px 0;
	border-bottom: {vb:stylevar popup_border};
	background: {vb:stylevar popup_header_background};
	color: {vb:stylevar popup_header_text_color};
	font-size: 18px;
	height: 30px;
	line-height: 30px;
	-moz-border-radius-topleft: 3px;
	-moz-border-radius-topright: 3px;
	-moz-border-radius-bottomright: 0;
	-moz-border-radius-bottomleft: 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 3px 3px 0 0;
	border-radius: 3px 3px 0 0;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar .ui-dialog-title {
	margin:0;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar-close {
	margin-top: -16px;
	{vb:stylevar right}:5px;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar-close.ui-state-hover,
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar-close.ui-state-focus {
	background:none;
	border-color:transparent;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .ui-dialog-titlebar-close .ui-icon {
	background: transparent url("images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png") no-repeat scroll -160px -112px;
	height: 16px;
	width: 17px;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .sb-dialog {
	-moz-border-radius-topleft: 0;
	-moz-border-radius-topright: 0;
	-moz-border-radius-bottomright: 3px;
	-moz-border-radius-bottomleft: 3px;
	-webkit-border-radius:0 0 3px 3px;
	border-radius:0 0 3px 3px;
	padding:20px;
}
.sb-dialog {
	position:relative;
	display:none;
}
.sb-dialog .dialog-content .loading-icon {
	position:absolute;
	{vb:stylevar left}:50%;
	top:50%;
	margin:-32px 0 0 -8px;
}
.sb-dialog .loader {
	text-align:center;
}
.dialog-content .vb-icon-error,
.dialog-content .vb-icon-warning {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 15px;
}
.dialog-content select {
	max-width: 95%;
}
.dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .message {
	margin-top:2px;
}
.dialog-container.prompt-dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .message {
	margin:0 0 10px 0;
	width:auto;
}
.dialog-container.prompt-dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .message.td {
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}:10px;
	width:5%;
	white-space:nowrap;
}
.dialog-container.prompt-dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .input-box-container.td {
	width:95%;
}
.dialog-container.prompt-dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .input-box {
	width:95.2%;
}
.dialog-container.dialog-box .dialog-content .icon.no-icon + .message {
	width:100%;
	margin-top:0;
}

/* Poll */
form.poll ul.poll {
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}:0;
	padding-top:0;
	padding-bottom:13px;
}
form.poll ul.poll li {
	list-style-type:none;
	line-height:22px;
	margin-top:6px;
}
form.poll ul.poll li:first-child {
	margin-top:0;
}
form.poll ul.poll li label {
	display:block;
}
form.poll ul.poll li label input {
	margin-top:3px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:7px;
	margin-bottom:3px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:1px;
	vertical-align:bottom;
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
}
form.poll ul.poll li label .poll-item {
	display:inline-block;
}
.list-item-poll .post-content .post-content-text {
	padding-bottom: 10px;
}
.list-item-poll.deleted .b-button-group {
	display:none;
}
.pollresults .pollvote-count {
	background: {vb:stylevar body_link_color};
	color: {vb:stylevar poll_result_vote_count_text};
	height: 26px;
	line-height: 26px;
	padding: 0 10px;
	-moz-border-radius: 2px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 2px;
	border-radius: 2px;
}
.pollresults .pollvote-count span {
	font-size: 14px;
	font-weight: bold;
}
.pollresults .pollvote-count label {
	font-size: 11px;
}
.pollresults-data {
	width:100%;
	margin-top:37px;
	margin-bottom:15px;
	clear:both;
}
.b-post--poll .pollresults-data{
	float:{vb:stylevar left};
	clear:none;
}
.list-item-poll.deleted.show-deleted-content .pollresults-data {
	margin-bottom:0;
}
.pollresults-data tr td {
	padding:8px 0 0 0;
	vertical-align:bottom;
	white-space:nowrap;
}
.pollresults-data tr:first-child td {
	padding-top:0;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.polloption-cell {
	width:94%;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollpercent-cell {
	width:1%;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvote-cell {
	width:5%;
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 25px;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollpercent-cell .percentage {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_percentage_background};
	border: {vb:stylevar poll_result_border};
	border-{vb:stylevar left}:0;
	font-size: 14px;
	font-weight: bold;
	height: 27px;
	line-height: 27px;
	padding: 0 10px;
	text-align: {vb:stylevar right};
	white-space: nowrap;
	-moz-border-radius: 0 2px 2px 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 0 2px 2px 0;
	border-radius: 0 2px 2px 0;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvote-cell .votes {
	height: 29px;
	line-height: 29px;
	text-align: {vb:stylevar right};
	white-space: nowrap;
	font-size:12px;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvote-cell .votes span {
	font-weight:bold;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.polloption-cell .title {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:2px;
	white-space:normal;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.polloption-cell .bar-container {
	background: #FFF;
	border: {vb:stylevar poll_result_border};
	border-{vb:stylevar right}:0;
	height: 23px;
	margin-top: 2px;
	padding:2px;
	-moz-border-radius: 2px 0 0 2px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 2px 0 0 2px;
	border-radius: 2px 0 0 2px;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.polloption-cell .bar-container .bar {
	height: 23px;
	-moz-border-radius: 2px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 2px;
	border-radius: 2px;
}
.pollresults-data .option-1 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_01};
}
.pollresults-data .option-2 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_02};
}
.pollresults-data .option-3 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_03};
}
.pollresults-data .option-4 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_04};
}
.pollresults-data .option-5 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_05};
}
.pollresults-data .option-6 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_06};
}
.pollresults-data .option-7 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_07};
}
.pollresults-data .option-8 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_08};
}
.pollresults-data .option-9 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_09};
}
.pollresults-data .option-10 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_10};
}
.pollresults-data .option-11 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_11};
}
.pollresults-data .option-12 .bar-container .bar {
	background: {vb:stylevar poll_result_color_12};
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvoter-cell {
	width:31px;
}
<vb:comment>/* This is the icon shown when votes are public. Click it to see who voted for that option. */</vb:comment>
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvoter-cell .voter-icon {
	background:transparent url(images/css/sprite_icons_vb_{vb:stylevar textdirection}.png) no-repeat scroll -448px -80px;
	width:21px;
	height:21px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:10px;
	margin-bottom:4px;
	cursor:pointer;
	position:relative;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvoter-cell .voter-icon .voters {
	display:none;
	position:absolute;
	{vb:stylevar right}:0;
	top:20px;
	border:1px solid {vb:stylevar body_link_color};
	background:#FFF;
	padding:7px;
	font-size:10px;
	width:150px;
	white-space:normal;
	z-index:100;
	cursor:text;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvoter-cell .voter-icon .voters .error {
	background:none;
	border:0;
	padding:0;
	text-align:{vb:stylevar left};
	color:{vb:stylevar poll_result_color_03};
	font-size:10px;
}
.pollresults-data tr td.pollvoter-cell .voter-icon .voters .note {
	font-size:10px;
	color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color};
}

/* css for timepicker */
.ui-timepicker-div .ui-widget-header { margin-bottom: 8px; }
.ui-timepicker-div dl{ text-align: {vb:stylevar left}; }
.ui-timepicker-div dl dt { height: 25px; margin-bottom: -25px; }
.ui-timepicker-div dl dd { margin: 0 10px 10px 65px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}:0; margin-{vb:stylevar left}:65px; }
.ui-timepicker-div td { font-size: 90%; }
.ui-tpicker-grid-label { background: none; border: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; }
#ui-datepicker-div { z-index: 9999999 !important; }



<vb:comment>
/*********************************************************************
 * Canvas Layout Rules
 *********************************************************************/
</vb:comment>

.canvas-layout-container {
	min-height:248px;
	height:auto;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout {
	border-color:inherit;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout .canvas-layout-row {
	border-color:inherit;
	width:100%;
	display: block;
	clear: both;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout .canvas-layout-row.has-columns {
	height:248px;
	border-color:inherit;
	display:table;
	width:100%;
	table-layout: fixed;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout.h-hide {
	display:none;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout .canvas-widget-list {
	padding-top:0px;
	display:block;
	vertical-align:top;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-layout .canvas-widget.container-widget .canvas-layout-row .canvas-widget-list {
	display:block;
	width: 100%;
}
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.container-widget {
	margin-bottom: 0;
}
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.hidden-widget-placeholder,
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.container-widget.empty {
	display:none;
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.collapsed {
	padding-bottom:0;
	padding-top:11px;
	/*background: transparent !important;*/
}
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget {
	background:#EBF7FF;
	border-color:#D8E6E6;
}
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border > .widget-header .module-title {
	margin: 0 0 8px 0;
	color: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_font};
}
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border.widget-tabs > .widget-header.widget-tabs-nav .module-title {
	font: {vb:stylevar module_tab_font};
	-moz-border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} 0 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} 0 0;
	border-radius: {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} {vb:stylevar module_tabbar_border_radius_size} 0 0;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.search-fields-widget .widget-header,
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.registration-widget .widget-header,
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.forgot-password-widget .widget-header { */
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .search-fields-widget .widget-header,
.view-mode .registration-widget .widget-header,
.view-mode .forgot-password-widget .widget-header {
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 30px;
	padding-top: 5px;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.search-fields-widget .widget-header .module-title { */
</vb:comment>
.view-mode .search-fields-widget .module-title {
	margin-bottom: 20px;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
 * .view-mode.logged-out .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-border > .widget-header .module-title { */
</vb:comment>
.logged-out .widget-no-border .module-title {
	margin-bottom:16px;
}



/* .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-header .module-title { */
.module-title {
	color:{vb:stylevar module_header_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar module_header_font};
	text-transform: {vb:stylevar module_header_text_transform};
	margin:9px 15px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:39px;
	overflow: hidden;
	width: 100%;
	overflow-wrap: break-word;
	word-wrap: break-word;
}
.module-title h1 {
	color:{vb:stylevar module_header_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar module_header_font};
	text-align: {vb:stylevar module_header_text_align};
	<vb:comment>/* padding to account for the collapse icon */</vb:comment>
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 50px;
}
.page-title-widget .module-title,
.page-title-widget .module-title h1 {
	color:{vb:stylevar primary_module_header_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_font};
	text-transform: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_text_transform};
	text-align: {vb:stylevar primary_module_header_text_align};
}

/*
#wrapper #canvas-layout-wide-narrow .canvas-widget-list.section-1 .widget-header .title,
#wrapper #canvas-layout-narrow-wide .canvas-widget-list.section-0 .widget-header .title {
	width:83%;
}*/
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-header .sort-by {
*/
</vb:comment>
.widget-header .sort-by
	margin:6px 10px 6px 5px;
}

<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.edit-mode.lnkEditPage .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-header .sort-by,
.edit-mode.lnkNewPage .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-header .sort-by {
*/
</vb:comment>
.edit-mode.lnkEditPage .sort-by,
.edit-mode.lnkNewPage .sort-by {
	display:none;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.wol-widget .widget-content.display-avatar {
*/
</vb:comment>
.wol-widget .display-avatar {
	margin-bottom: -10px;
}
.wol-location {
	vertical-align: middle;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px;
}
.wollist-widget .vb-icon-wrapper {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 4px;
	height: 16px;
}
.wollist-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper {
	margin-bottom: 0;
}
.post-date{
	font-size:11px;
	color:{vb:stylevar time_stamp_color};
}
<vb:comment>Start module button css</vb:comment>
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header .module-buttons {
	line-height: 14px;
	margin: -7px 0 0;
	position: absolute;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 15px;
	top: 50%;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header .module-buttons .module-button-item {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:2px;
	cursor:pointer;
}
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header .module-buttons .module-button-item:first-child {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:0;
}
.view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.widget-no-header-buttons > .widget-header .module-buttons {
	display:none;
}
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header .module-buttons .module-button-item span {
	display: inline-block;
	height: 14px;
	width: 14px;
	margin: 0;
	text-indent: -99999px;
}
.canvas-layout-container .widget-header .module-icon {
	display:none;
}
<vb:comment>End module button css</vb:comment>

.canvas-layout-container .widget-content .widget-channel-list li.note {
	line-height:15px;
}
.canvas-layout-container .youtube-widget .videocontainer iframe {
	width:100%;
}
.canvas-layout-container .youtube-widget .youtube-video {
	width:100%;
}
#canvas-layout-full .youtube-widget .youtube-video {
	height:600px;
}
#canvas-layout-wide-narrow .section-0 .youtube-widget .youtube-video,
#canvas-layout-narrow-wide .section-1 .youtube-widget .youtube-video {
	height:415px;
}
#canvas-layout-wide-narrow .section-1 .youtube-widget .youtube-video,
#canvas-layout-narrow-wide .section-0 .youtube-widget .youtube-video {
	height:173px;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog.input-dialog {
	-moz-border-radius: 6px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 6px;
	border-radius: 6px;
}
.dialog-container .sb-dialog .subheader {
	font-size:16px;
	font-weight:bold;
}
.dialog-container .dialog-content {
	margin-bottom:8px;
}
#vb-page-body .ui-widget-overlay {
	background: {vb:stylevar popup_overlay_background};
	opacity:0.5;
	filter:Alpha(Opacity=50);
}

/** Search widget styles */

.list-container .list-item .list-item-footer {
	padding: 5px 0;
}

.list-container .replylike_count li {
	float: {vb:stylevar left};
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
	font-size: 11px;
}

.list-container .replylike_count,
.list-container .replylike_count li:first-child,
.list-container .replylike_count div {
	display: inline;
	max-width: 100%;
}

.list-container .replylike_count .channel_text {
	overflow: hidden;
	overflow-wrap: break-word;
	word-wrap: break-word;
	display: inline;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .photo_result .slider_image {
	border: 3px solid #A9A9A9;
	max-width: 260px;
	max-height: 160px;
	margin: auto;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .anythingWindow {
	border: 3px solid #A9A9A9;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .conversation_slider .photo_container {
	min-height: 200px;
	margin: auto;
	padding:0;
	position: relative;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .conversation_slider .photo_container .photo_container_header .photo_title {
	background: #C1D2EE;
	text-align: center;
	overflow-wrap: break-word;
	word-wrap: break-word;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .conversation_slider .photo_container .photo_container_body .slider_panel .slider_image {
	max-width: 260px;
	max-height: 160px;
	margin: auto;
	width: auto;
}

.list-container .list-item .list-item-body .conversation_slider .photo_container .photo_container_body .gallery_navigation {
	border-top: 3px solid #A9A9A9;
}

.condense_control {
	font-size: 10px;
	color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color};
	text-decoration: {vb:stylevar body_link_decoration};
	font-weight: bold;
	display: block;
	margin-top: 10px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
}

/* search widgets styles End */

.canvas-layout-container .summary-widget{
	background-color: {vb:stylevar module_content_background};
}

.profile-sidebar-widget .profileContainer .profile-photo-wrapper .edit-profile,
.groupSummaryContainer .sg-icon-wrapper .editGroupIcon,
.blogSummaryContainer .blog-icon-wrapper .editBlogIcon {
	position: absolute;
	bottom: 0;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
	background: {vb:stylevar side_nav_number_messages_color};
	font-weight: bold;
	color: white;
	font-size: 12px;
	padding: 2px 7px;
	cursor: pointer;
	display:none;
}

.profile-sidebar-widget .profileContainer .profile-photo-wrapper:hover .edit-profile,
.groupSummaryContainer .sg-icon-wrapper:hover .editGroupIcon,
.blogSummaryContainer .blog-icon-wrapper:hover .editBlogIcon {
	display:block;
}

/* activity filters */
.stream-filter {
	cursor: pointer;
}
.new-conversations-strip {
	cursor: pointer;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
	background: lightpink;
	padding: 5px;
	display:none;
}
/*Conversation Bar*/
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper {
	margin-bottom:15px;
	position:relative;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper.top {
	padding:0 !important;
	border:none;
}
.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper {
	margin-bottom:-1px;
}
.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-left > li {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 30px;
}
.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .sort-controls > label {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px;
}
.widget-tabs .conversation-toolbar-wrapper,
.blog-conversation-content-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper {
	margin-bottom:0;
}

.conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar,
.forum-list-container .forum-list-header {
	background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_background};
	border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_border};
	height: 36px;
	line-height:36px;
	position: relative;
	color:{vb:stylevar toolbar_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar toolbar_font};
}
.forum-list-container .forum-list-header {
	font: {vb:stylevar forum_list_header_font};
}

.widget-content .widget-subheader {
	background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_background};
	border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_border};
	height: 35px;
	padding:4px;
	position: relative;
	color:{vb:stylevar toolbar_text_color};
	-webkit-box-sizing: border-box; /* Safari/Chrome, other WebKit */
	-moz-box-sizing: border-box;	/* Firefox, other Gecko */
	box-sizing: border-box;		 /* Opera/IE 8+ */
}

.history-backbutton
{
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:10px;
}
.history-backbutton-img
{
	margin-top:3px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:10px;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper.bottom {
	margin-top:20px;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-left {
	{vb:stylevar left}:10px;
}
.ie7 .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-left {
	min-width:111px;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-left > li {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:10px;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .sort-controls .selectBox-dropdown {
	margin-top:-3px;
}
.conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-right {

	background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_start.backgroundColor}, {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_background_gradient_end.backgroundColor});

.gallery-wrapper {

}
.gallery-wrapper .file-chooser {

}
.upload-photo-dialog-container {

}

	margin-bottom:0;
}

	min-width: 60px;
	margin: 0;
}
.allowed-filetypes {
	font-size:11px;
	line-height:26px;
	height:26px;
	color:#777;
}
.gallery-wrapper .allowed-filetypes {

}
.upload-photo-dialog-container .gallery-wrapper .allowed-filetypes {

.gallery-wrapper .photo-display-container.entry-field {

	/*margin-top:150px;*/

}
.ie7 .gallery-wrapper .photo-display-container.entry-field {
	width:99.8%;
	margin-top:183px;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display {
	margin-top:10px;
	/*position:relative;*/
}
.upload-photo-dialog-container .gallery-wrapper .photo-display {
	margin:0;
	min-height:263px;
	max-height:525px;
	overflow:hidden;
}
.upload-photo-dialog-container.has-scrollbar .gallery-wrapper .photo-display {
	overflow:auto;
}
.dialog-container.ui-dialog .sb-dialog.photo-display-container {
	padding:0;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item-wrapper {
	border:{vb:stylevar popup_border};
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}:-1px;
	margin-top:-1px;
	height:261px;
	width: 200px;
}
.attach-limit-warning {
	margin-bottom: 2px;
	border: 0;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item-wrapper.last-in-row {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}:0;
}
.upload-photo-dialog-container.has-scrollbar .gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item-wrapper.last-in-row {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}:{vb:stylevar popup_border};
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}:10px;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item-wrapper:first-child {
	-moz-border-radius:3px 0 0 0;
	-webkit-border-radius:3px 0 0 0;
	border-radius:3px 0 0 0;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item-wrapper:first-child + .photo-item-wrapper + .photo-item-wrapper {
	-moz-border-radius:0 3px 0 0;
	-webkit-border-radius:0 3px 0 0;
	border-radius:0 3px 0 0;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnail-container {
	height: 100%;
	position: relative;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnail-container .thumbnailbox-wrapper .thumbnailbox {
	display:table-cell;
	height: 180px;
	width: 180px;
	vertical-align:middle;
	padding:10px;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnail-container .thumbnailbox-wrapper {
	display:table;
	height: 200px;
	width: 200px;
	table-layout:fixed;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnail-container .thumbnailbox-wrapper .thumbnailbox .thumbnail {
	height: auto;
	width: auto;
	max-height: 180px;
	max-width: 180px;
	position:relative;
}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnail-container .divider {
	border:{vb:stylevar popup_border};
	width: 180px;
	margin:0 10px;
}
<vb:comment>
/* Selector reduction:
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .remove-icon {
*/
</vb:comment>
.photo-item .vb-icon-trash-blue {
	position: absolute;

}

}
.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .thumbnailbox .thumbnail-holder:hover .remove-icon {

.gallery-wrapper .photo-display .photo-item .photo-caption {

.photo-display-result .gallery-details {

.photo-details a[href].photo-count span.title {

.galleryLink {

.galleryLink .thumbnail-photo {

	height:auto;
}
